subject: Maria Mercado Will be Terminated from Language & Culture Worldwide on July 31st, 2023
body:
We've received your request to terminate Maria Mercado on 07/31/2023. Don't worry, we won't send them any communication. 
Here's what Zenefits will take care of:
Payroll: We'll remove Maria from your payroll, and they will not be paid going forward (unless you choose to manually mark them as "active"). 
Here's what you need to take care of:
 
Final Payment: Each state has a different law regarding when a company must give terminated employees their final paychecks. Please refer to the Final Paycheck law for NJ to find out when you have cut this employee's final paycheck. We recommend that you confirm the final amount you owe Maria with your payroll provider before cutting the check. 
Termination & Severance Paperwork: If your company uses any termination forms, you'll want to get the individual to sign them and you'll want to 
add the signed documents here
 for future reference. 
If you have any questions or concerns feel free to 
contact us.
 
Thanks,
Zenefits
For more information or assistance, please visit 
help.zenefits.com
.

subject: Melissa Horne Neu Will be Terminated from Language & Culture Worldwide on July 28th, 2023
body:
We've received your request to terminate Melissa Horne Neu on 07/28/2023. Don't worry, we won't send them any communication. 
Here's what Zenefits will take care of:
Payroll: We'll mark Melissa for termination in payroll on 
07/28/2023
, and continue to pay them unless you manually remove them. Issue their last pay check by running termination payroll. 
Not sure how? 
We recommend you understand 
your state's specific final paycheck requirements 
to remain compliant with the law. 
Here's what you need to take care of:
 
Final Payment: Each state has a different law regarding when a company must give terminated employees their final paychecks. Please refer to the Final Paycheck law for SC to find out when you have cut this employee's final paycheck. We recommend that you confirm the final amount you owe Melissa with your payroll provider before cutting the check. 
Paid Time Off: South Carolina law may require you to pay employees for their unused PTO upon termination, but you should check with your lawyer or accountant. If you do owe employees for unused PTO, make sure to add $1,038.46 to their final paycheck. 
Termination & Severance Paperwork: If your company uses any termination forms, you'll want to get the individual to sign them and you'll want to 
add the signed documents here
 for future reference. 
If you have any questions or concerns feel free to 
contact us.
 
Thanks,
Zenefits
For more information or assistance, please visit 
help.zenefits.com
.

subject: Jake Pieczynski Has Been Terminated from Language & Culture Worldwide on July 14th, 2023
body:
We've received your request to terminate Jake Pieczynski on 07/14/2023. Don't worry, we won't send them any communication. 
Here's what Zenefits will take care of:
Payroll: We'll remove Jake from your payroll, and they will not be paid going forward (unless you choose to manually mark them as "active"). 
Here's what you need to take care of:
 
Final Payment: Each state has a different law regarding when a company must give terminated employees their final paychecks. Please refer to the Final Paycheck law for IL to find out when you have cut this employee's final paycheck. We recommend that you confirm the final amount you owe Jake with your payroll provider before cutting the check. 
Termination & Severance Paperwork: If your company uses any termination forms, you'll want to get the individual to sign them and you'll want to 
add the signed documents here
 for future reference. 
If you have any questions or concerns feel free to 
contact us.
 
Thanks,
Zenefits
For more information or assistance, please visit 
help.zenefits.com
.

subject: FW: accounting@
body:
Hey there
It looks like 
accounting@lcwmail.com
 is shared…. 
Can you see if you can share it with me? 
p.coulter@lcwmail.com
 
 
From: 
Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com>
Date: 
Friday, February 10, 2023 at 3:38 PM
To: 
Pamela Coulter <p.coulter@lcwmail.com>
Subject: 
RE: accounting@
It doesn’t have a password – it is shared…and can only be accessed by people who are logged into their own email account (and it is then shared with them). 
 
Tech Support should be able to guide you how to make it appear in your list of email accounts in your Outlook – that’s a bit beyond my scope, unfortunately!
Cheers,
Randy

 Pamela Coulter <p.coulter@lcwmail.com>

subject: [Important] Your 2nd Quarter Payroll Tax Reconciliation is Complete
body:
Hi,
Reconciliation runs are part of a payroll provider's normal quarter's-end reconciliation process. Zenefits Payroll is running those corrections to ensure you pay the correct amount to each tax jurisdiction where you're liable for payroll taxes.
When we do reconciliations, we look for variances between what we collected in taxes from your pay runs in the quarter and what the tax agencies expect you to pay. In some cases, we'll find variances between these two amounts. Variances are normal, and can be the result of a number of things.
Here's a snapshot of where you stand, and what will happen next:
For your Full-Service jurisdictions, we will automatically create pay runs in your account and you'll see the following net amount 
credited to 
your bank account ending in ******6303 by July 11, 2023 for $0.04 for Unemployment Tax.
For additional details, please feel free to review your 
All In One report
 from your Payroll app.
Thanks, 
Zenefits 
Questions or concerns? Visit 
help.zenefits.com
. 
© Zenefits

Subject: 
Antonio Jones Accounting onboarding sessions
Good afternoon,
 
As you are all aware our new controller, Toni Jones starts this Wednesday, July 5
th
. I’ll be doing his general onboarding sessions the first day and a half but I do not have any role specific sessions scheduled after that. 
@Michelle Murcia
 or 
@Pamela Coulter
 do you have some sort of accounting manual you can share with Toni? I spoke to Randy today and he said you all have been documenting the different processes throughout these past months. Do you have time to lead a few specific accounting onboarding sessions Friday or early next week? 
 
What else besides QuickBooks, DropBox and Compass will he need to have? 
 
Kendall is leading an intro to Dropbox and intro to Compass session but it will only be general, not a deep dive into those systems. 
Below are a list of topics Randy and Jennifer had for David’s onboarding back in Nov. 
Travel Expenses
QB Accounts & Invoicing
Invoice Submission
Payables
QB & Bank Feeds
Payroll
Month End Tasks & Reporting
Month End Reporting Project 
 
Please let me know how I should schedule his onboarding plan.
 
Thanks,
 
Briza Cardenas
(she/her/hers)

Subject: 
Antonio Jones Accounting onboarding sessions
Good afternoon,
 
As you are all aware our new controller, Toni Jones starts this Wednesday, July 5
th
. I’ll be doing his general onboarding sessions the first day and a half but I do not have any role specific sessions scheduled after that. 
@Michelle Murcia
 or 
@Pamela Coulter
 do you have some sort of accounting manual you can share with Toni? I spoke to Randy today and he said you all have been documenting the different processes throughout these past months. Do you have time to lead a few specific accounting onboarding sessions Friday or early next week? 
 
What else besides QuickBooks, DropBox and Compass will he need to have? 
 
Kendall is leading an intro to Dropbox and intro to Compass session but it will only be general, not a deep dive into those systems. 
Below are a list of topics Randy and Jennifer had for David’s onboarding back in Nov. 
Travel Expenses
QB Accounts & Invoicing
Invoice Submission
Payables
QB & Bank Feeds
Payroll
Month End Tasks & Reporting
Month End Reporting Project 
 
Please let me know how I should schedule his onboarding plan.
 
Thanks,
 
Briza Cardenas
(she/her/hers)

subject: Re: Antonio Jones Accounting onboarding sessions
body:
I will hold some time on Thursday from 2pm-5pm for training on billing if you’d like to book that now.
 
Since this is our June month end close period through 7/15 and a short week, we will need to identify a time that works on our end for the balance of the month-end close.
 
Pam can train on payroll for sure on 7/12.  I will let her identify the best time to walk through the process.
 
In the meantime, access to the accounting email will be critical to success.  I can walk him through the categorization and filing of the inbox for 30 minutes on Wednesday afternoon at 2:30pm if you’d like to book that now.
 
Thank you, Briza. Enjoy the holiday!
 
 
Michelle Murcia
Accounting, 
LCW

Subject: 
Antonio Jones Accounting onboarding sessions
Good afternoon,
 
As you are all aware our new controller, Toni Jones starts this Wednesday, July 5
th
. I’ll be doing his general onboarding sessions the first day and a half but I do not have any role specific sessions scheduled after that. 
@Michelle Murcia
 or 
@Pamela Coulter
 do you have some sort of accounting manual you can share with Toni? I spoke to Randy today and he said you all have been documenting the different processes throughout these past months. Do you have time to lead a few specific accounting onboarding sessions Friday or early next week? 
 
What else besides QuickBooks, DropBox and Compass will he need to have? 
 
Kendall is leading an intro to Dropbox and intro to Compass session but it will only be general, not a deep dive into those systems. 
Below are a list of topics Randy and Jennifer had for David’s onboarding back in Nov. 
Travel Expenses

Hi Pamela, 
We're writing to let you know that the results of the background check you requested for Toni are ready. We've attached a link to the full background check results in this email for your reference (login required): 
https://secure.zenefits.com/background_check/8262936

.

Cc: 
Pamela Coulter <p.coulter@lcwmail.com>, Maria Mercado <m.mercado@lcwmail.com>, Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com>, Briza Cardenas <b.cardenas@lcwmail.com>
Subject: 
RE: Payroll 6/30/2023
Hi. Of those that need to turn it in immedaitely, we’ve received all but Grace, Nassise, and Ashton (a little more complicated). They had 7 days to sign it and, I assume providing time for mailing it in, 5 days to then get it to us.
 
Melissa and Jeffery have a longer period of time and should not be paid out of this payroll. Jake, Melissa and Ashton have an extended exit date in July.
 
My suggestion is the following:
 
Pay out severance in this period (they’ve signed and exited)
Hannah
Kaitlin
 
Payout in first July period (assuming they make the 7/30 deadline)
Grace
Nassise
 
Payout in last July period (assuming they make the 7/30 deadline)
Jake
Ashton
 
Payout in first August period
Maria M (potentially)
Melissa
 
Jeffery is the wild card that we are working with separately. Because of age he has a longer time to consider the offer and we are talking with him about the amount.
 
We can also run off-cycle runs for those who come in at or just before the upcoming deadline if we just want to clear the books asap.
 
Briza – Please check my understanding of the statuses and timing.
 
______________________________________
Chuck Adams 
Co-CEO and Managing Principal

Chicago, IL 60640

subject: Toni Jones Zenefits Onboarding Complete
body:
Hi Pamela, 
Toni Jones just finished onboarding in Zenefits! All their personal, bank and tax information will be synced to Zenefits Payroll 2 business days before their hire date of 07/05/2023 We're cc'ing your accountant so they have this information, in case they handle everything payroll. 
In the documents section of their 
profile
, you'll find their hire documents (e.g., offer letter, agreements) and tax documents (e.g., W-4, or W-9), as applicable.
Here's what you'll need to do to make sure Toni is all set:
 
Within 3 days of their first day, you should 
complete the employer's section of Form I-9 in Zenefits
. To comply with USCIS regulations, you'll need to view physical copies of the individual's work-verification documents; here's a 
list of acceptable documents
.
If Toni hadn't finished onboarding in time for their first payroll date, you may need to run an off-cycle payroll.
If you have any questions, feel free to 
contact us.
 
Thanks,
Zenefits
For more information or assistance, please visit 
help.zenefits.com
.

subject: RE: Invitation from LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE, LLC is waiting for your response
body:
Hi Pamela,
 
Could you please provide an update on this?
Both for how we are doing the payments for Uta Lausberg, as well as Mario Baruzzo. 
They are both located outside the US and therefore cannot receive payment via Bill.com.
Both indicated to have received an email from Bill.com regarding their last invoice and were concerned that they will not receive their payment correctly, which should be sent via ACH transfer. (this was confirmed by accounting last month to Uta)
 
I also attach an email I still received from Uta, as she was not able to get hold of you and is concerned about late payment (as this happened last time).
 
Can you please update both the translators and myself on confirmation for their payments via ACH transfer?
 
Thank you,
Best,
Maya
 
Maya Benoit
Translation Coordinator, LCW

m.benoit@lcwmail.com
Phone: +1.773.977.4561

could you please explain to me why I am receiving the below email from bill.com? I thought we had clarified that I cannot receive payments through this provider.
 
Could you please confirm that you have issued an international wire transfer for me instead? Please include the details of the wire transfer so that I can track it with my bank here.
 
Please 
DO NOT USE BILL.COM TO PAY ME

Uta

subject: Scoro Update: Introducing Reports Library and Shareable Gantt Chart
body:
Good news! Your Scoro site lcw.scoro.com has been updated! This month we’re all about better insights – our brand new Reports Li...
 
 
 
Log in → 
 
Good news! Your Scoro site 
lcw.scoro.com
 has been updated!
This month we’re all about better insights – our brand new Reports Library makes it easier than ever to delve deep into various aspects of your business while a tiny new button in the Gantt chart will forever change the way you share project insights with your clients. 
See what we’ve been up to!
Shareable Gantt chart
Scoro’s Gantt chart is a powerful visual tool that helps you plan out your project and maintain a real-time overview of its scope, timeline, current state and progress. Now you can easily share these insights with your clients as well by showing them the Gantt chart.
 We’ve added the long-awaited 
Share chart
 button to the Gantt chart view. It creates 
a snapshot of the current state of the chart
 and generates a unique link which you can share with people outside your organization. This makes it easier to confirm timelines, align expectations and keep all interested parties up to date and on the same page. You can 
update the snapshot
 manually at any point to ensure it reflects the latest changes and developments. 
Read more
 
Reports Library
Powerful reporting capabilities are one of the pillars of Scoro, helping you analyze various types of data so you wouldn’t have to run your business on a hunch. To save you time and give you even quicker access to valuable insights, we’ve now launched a 
Reports Library
. It includes shortcuts to almost 50 useful reports that help you measure and analyze the key aspects of your business – 
productivity, utilization, revenue, cost, profitability
 and 
sales
. Head on over to the Reports module to browse the library. You can easily customize these ready-made reports further with any additional filters or data columns you need. 
Read more
 
Triggers and actions: dynamic exclusion
Last month we launched our new and improved 
Triggers and actions
 feature to support more complex automations. As a result of the update, you can now also assign dynamic roles, such as creator, responsible user or assignee, as notification recipients. This month we’re adding another dynamic group into the mix – the 
All users except me
 option makes it easier and faster to set up rules to notify you whenever anyone but you modifies some task, event, quote or any other relevant item. 
Read more
 
That's not all! 
See our blog post for more details
.
We do our very best to make Scoro better every day, so we really appreciate your feedback. Let us know what you think at 
help@scoro.com
.
Yours truly,
Team Scoro
 
 
 
© 2023 Scoro Software. | 
www.scoro.com
 
Scoro Software Ltd | The Frames, 1 Phipp Street, EC2A 4PS | London, United Kingdom 
If you need assistance or have any questions, please contact our 
Customer Support
.

subject: COBRA Complete COBRA Employer Portal Registration  - Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC -  [#1260262]
body:
Good Morning,
Welcome to COBRA Complete. The below process will allow you access to the COBRA Complete COBRA Employer Portal. The Portal provides you with secure, 24-hour access to review and manage your consumers’ COBRA accounts.
Attached is the COBRA Employer Portal Guide and Reporting Guide for your reference when navigating the site.
To access your account for the first time, please follow the below link:
            
https://cobra-complete.com
 
Click New User Registration and enter the registration code provided below:
Registration Code: 9VaNHu9Q
Enter your EIN, which is your company’s tax ID number.
Accept the New User License Agreement.
Create a unique user name and password. 
You will receive a validation email from 
no-reply@myhealthpayment.com
 please follow the validation instructions. Once validated you have access to the COBRA Complete COBRA Employer Portal.
 
Please feel free to reach out if you have any questions.
Thank you,
Kind regards,
Acerina A

could you please explain to me why I am receiving the below email from bill.com? I thought we had clarified that I cannot receive payments through this provider.
 
Could you please confirm that you have issued an international wire transfer for me instead? Please include the details of the wire transfer so that I can track it with my bank here.
 
Please 
DO NOT USE BILL.COM TO PAY ME
. I will never receive the funds. If this is the only way you will issue payments I could not work for your company any more. That would be really very sad!
 
Kind regards,
Uta
 
 
Dr. Uta Lausberg
Global Business Linguistics
4a. Calle Lote 108 Fr. 4
Residenciales Los Alpes, zona 1
03008 San Lucas Sacatepéquez
GUATEMALA
 
P +502 4063-9431
E 
info@globiztics.com
Skype: utalausberg
 
 
 
Von:
 BILL <account-services@hq.bill.com> 
Gesendet:
 Dienstag, 20. Juni 2023 15:18
An:
 info@globiztics.com
Betreff:
 Invitation from LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE, LLC is waiting for your response
 
LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE, LLC wants to pay you
We wanted to remind you that LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE, LLC wants to pay you. To receive payments, you can provide your information using a secure form. For additional security, the Get started link expires on June 24, 2023. 
Get started 
 
Provide your information and:
Avoid payment delays and errors
Choose your currency and delivery method.
For questions, contact LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE, LLC at 
p.coulter@lcwmail.com
 or call them at 773-828-6781.

From: 
Rosie Herren <
rosie@bookandstreet.com
>
Date: 
Tuesday, June 20, 2023 at 4:25 PM
To: 
Michelle Murcia <
m.murcia@lcwmail.com
>, Pamela Coulter <
p.coulter@lcwmail.com
>
Subject: 
Re: [DKIM Failure] Diligent credit
Credit memo was offset against an invoice: #1
7240330
 (11/21/22) and #
17240330 rev 
(4/1/23)
 
Duplicate pmt should have been posted as unapplied pmt on customers acct in 2022. Instead a credit memo was created in 2022 which hit revenue with deposit posted to deferred revenue. 
So overall AR balance was correct but deferred revenue and revenue was not. I corrected AR with 1/1/23 JE by debiting Deferred revenue and crediting A/R. 
However, this also required me to delete credit memo from Nov22 on 1/1/23 but couldn’t since we couldn’t change 2022 or Q1. To get things correct YTD I still need to cancel impact of credit memo but on 4/1/23.
 
To cancel impact of Nov22 credit memo,  I created invoice 
17240330 rev
 
dated 4/1/23 and applied Nov22 vendor credit 17240330 against this new invoice. AR aging now just shows credit of $12885 for Diligent from JE which represents credit on customer’s account from duplicate payment. Nothing in deferred revenue, cash is correct and sales net zero between the two years. 
 
If you would prefer I can reverse the JE dated 1/1/2 on 4/1/23 but if so then deferred revenue and sales will still need corrected with another JE. Typically speaking, duplicate payments are not handled with credit memos but usually come though on deposit transactions. We can’t alter the 11/1/22 deposit transaction however so a JE is the best we can do or else I have to create a fictitious deposit which I don’t want to do since it involves cash. I have T accounts on this to prove my logic but unable to scan to send to you right now. 
 
Rosie

Good Day,
 
The attached spreadsheet is meant to clarify the current state of the LAS-LCW invoices for the year 2023. Please confirm that the whole spreadsheet is correct. I would love confirmation that this spreadsheet contains all of the trainings that need payment worked out and that any training or workshops not on the spreadsheet have been paid in full. 
 
As highlighted on the spreadsheet, at this time two separate invoices, Invoice No. 17240307 and Invoice No. 17240375 were sent to LAS with incorrect amounts for payment and can not be processed until corrected. 
 
Additionally, at this time, as highlighted in the spreadsheet, there are 2 invoices that have not been sent for the remaining (.75) amount for two trainings/workshops that were provided to LAS. Having these final invoices will help us process both invoices in full at the same time to reduce confusion. 
 
The DEI Team at LAS values your facilitators and trainers' time and knowledge. We have truly appreciated the amazing trainings provided and always want to ensure the trainers are paid in an equitable and timely fashion. 
 
I look forward to your response. Please please don't hesitate to reach out to me for clarification by phone at 413-275-6208.
 
Best,
Jas

Good Day,
 
The attached spreadsheet is meant to clarify the current state of the LAS-LCW invoices for the year 2023. Please confirm that the whole spreadsheet is correct. I would love confirmation that this spreadsheet contains all of the trainings that need payment worked out and that any training or workshops not on the spreadsheet have been paid in full. 
 
As highlighted on the spreadsheet, at this time two separate invoices, Invoice No. 17240307 and Invoice No. 17240375 were sent to LAS with incorrect amounts for payment and can not be processed until corrected. 
 
Additionally, at this time, as highlighted in the spreadsheet, there are 2 invoices that have not been sent for the remaining (.75) amount for two trainings/workshops that were provided to LAS. Having these final invoices will help us process both invoices in full at the same time to reduce confusion. 
 
The DEI Team at LAS values your facilitators and trainers' time and knowledge. We have truly appreciated the amazing trainings provided and always want to ensure the trainers are paid in an equitable and timely fashion. 
 
I look forward to your response. Please please don't hesitate to reach out to me for clarification by phone at 413-275-6208.
 
Best,
Jas

My name is Lien and I am a product researcher at BILL.

If you qualify and share your feedback by completing a short 3-minute survey, you will have an opportunity to win one of four $100 virtual gift cards.*

subject: FW: DEI Training Invoices - Copies needed
body:
I spoke with Jasmina this morning in response to my past due AP inquiries.
 
This communication relates to another billing issue.  Lots of changes at LAS and internal AP policies drove the delay.  I’m going to work with Randy to develop a solution via Quickbooks to resolve the issue and get LCW paid.  I will also work with him to find a solution in Compass so there aren’t any discrepancies between the two systems.
 
I will review this in detail to understand their concerns (which we have discussed and she offered to document for my review) and will revert my approval if I agree.
 
@Randall Stieghorst
 let’s find a time!
@Andrea Wicks Bowles
 don’t make any change in Compass.
 
@Pamela Coulter
 I will review this with you in detail when the issue is resolved in Quickbooks.
 
 
Michelle Murcia
Accounting, 
LCW

m.murcia@lcwmail.com

From: 
Jasmina Chuck <JSChuck@legal-aid.org>
Date: 
Friday, June 16, 2023 at 1:25 PM
To: 
Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Cc: 
Andrea Wicks Bowles <a.wicksbowles@lcwmail.com>
Subject: 
Re: DEI Training Invoices - Copies needed
Good Day,
 
The attached spreadsheet is meant to clarify the current state of the LAS-LCW invoices for the year 2023. Please confirm that the whole spreadsheet is correct. I would love confirmation that this spreadsheet contains all of the trainings that need payment worked out and that any training or workshops not on the spreadsheet have been paid in full. 
 
As highlighted on the spreadsheet, at this time two separate invoices, Invoice No. 17240307 and Invoice No. 17240375 were sent to LAS with incorrect amounts for payment and can not be processed until corrected. 
 
Additionally, at this time, as highlighted in the spreadsheet, there are 2 invoices that have not been sent for the remaining (.75) amount for two trainings/workshops that were provided to LAS. Having these final invoices will help us process both invoices in full at the same time to reduce confusion. 
 
The DEI Team at LAS values your facilitators and trainers' time and knowledge. We have truly appreciated the amazing trainings provided and always want to ensure the trainers are paid in an equitable and timely fashion. 
 
I look forward to your response. Please please don't hesitate to reach out to me for clarification by phone at 413-275-6208.
 
Best,
Jas

subject: Grace Vottero Will be Terminated from Language & Culture Worldwide on June 16th, 2023
body:
We've received your request to terminate Grace Vottero on 06/16/2023. Don't worry, we won't send them any communication. 
Here's what Zenefits will take care of:
Payroll: We'll mark Grace for termination in payroll on 
06/16/2023
, and continue to pay them unless you manually remove them. Issue their last pay check by running termination payroll. 
Not sure how? 
We recommend you understand 
your state's specific final paycheck requirements 
to remain compliant with the law. 
Here's what you need to take care of:
 
Final Payment: Each state has a different law regarding when a company must give terminated employees their final paychecks. Please refer to the Final Paycheck law for NJ to find out when you have cut this employee's final paycheck. We recommend that you confirm the final amount you owe Grace with your payroll provider before cutting the check. 
Paid Time Off: New Jersey law does not require you to pay employees for their unused PTO upon termination. However, if you wish to pay out employees for unused PTO, you'll want to add $1,346.92 to their final paycheck. 
Termination & Severance Paperwork: If your company uses any termination forms, you'll want to get the individual to sign them and you'll want to 
add the signed documents here
 for future reference. 
If you have any questions or concerns feel free to 
contact us.
 
Thanks,
Zenefits
For more information or assistance, please visit 
help.zenefits.com
.

subject: AW: Payment to Uta Lausberg de Morales
body:
Dear Pamela,
 
I agreed with Maria that in my case, 
bill.com is NOT to be used
 but payment should be issued via international wire transfer.
 
The reason is that my Guatemalan bank rejects the payment from this provider because they do not work with this type of provider. I checked this with my bank. They can only receive payments from ordinary banks.
 
The only way I can receive your payment is via international wire transfer to my bank account in Guatemala. The information is contained in my invoice.
 
Please let me know if you are not sure how to issue a wire transfer. I can try to help you find out. Previously, Randall Stieghorst issued my payments and he might be able to provide support also.
 
Kind regards,
Uta
 
 
Dr. Uta Lausberg
Global Business Linguistics
4a. Calle Lote 108 Fr. 4
Residenciales Los Alpes, zona 1
03008 San Lucas Sacatepéquez
GUATEMALA

Please be informed that, in 'Calculate Only', Trinet Zenefits will calculate any employee/employer taxes related to a jurisdiction and display this amount in your quarterly tax package. With Calculate Only, Zenefits will not withdraw funds for the calculated taxes, remit the calculated tax amounts, file tax returns, or resolve notices for the respective tax agency.

subject: Language & Culture Worldwide: Tax Notice from Minnesota Unemployment Insurance: Support Case # 03742821
body:
Hi Pamela,  
Thank you for reaching out to TriNet Zenefits Customer Care. My name is Michelle and I'm happy to assist you today. I understand that you need assistance about the tax notice you received from Minnesota Department of Employment and Economic Development.
I have checked this issue for you and found that Zenefits does not have the capability to apply credit to your account. Here, you will please need to call the tax agency and see what the credit is for. You will please need to reach out to the agency and request a refund check.
I hope this information helps. Please let us know if you have any questions.  
  
Best,  
Michelle 
Michelle M. | Customer Care Advocate | TriNet Zenefits | www.zenefits.com
Have questions? Get answers at https://help.zenefits.com.

Michelle Murcia

From: 
Briza Cardenas <b.cardenas@lcwmail.com>
Date: 
Thursday, June 1, 2023 at 1:36 PM
To: 
Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>, Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com>, Pamela Coulter <p.coulter@lcwmail.com>
Subject: 
RE: Reimbursement Process at LCW
I am aware of that process but with the updated handbook and what Maria M presented at the retreat the below and this part of an email chain do not align.
 
Employee fills out the attached template with receipts and emails it to their manager for approval.
Once the manager approval is made via email, this email chain with the expense template and receipts will be sent to 
payablelcw@bill.com
 for processing, 
CC 
accounting@lcwmail.com
 so I can make sure it hits bill.com. We have been having issues with it not coming through to bill.com.
If the employee is new to bill.com, they will be requested to enter in their banking information for direct deposit reimbursement
IDEA - perhaps part of new employee on boarding they are set up in bill.com.
Accounting@lcwmail.com
 would need their name, copy of their w9, and an email
Then bill.com invites them to fill in their banking info.
Employee reimbursements are processed in the next payment cycle 
(15
th
 or 31
st
) 
from date of receipt. 
 
I’m asking to meet to clarify some questions before answering the staff’s questions and concerns. It would be easier to meet instead of emailing back and forth 
 
Briza Cardenas

$1050 increase to expense on Eisner Advisory Jan23 bill no. 1231262. Change made by Alisa Kolodizner on 5/12/23
 
7003.2 Computer Support 
$1206.25 increase to expense on TeamLogic Feb23 bills no. 1364 and 1371. Adds made by Alisa Kolodizner on 5/12/23

6007.03 Hotels through 6007.08 Taxi/Ground 
$850.30 increase to expense on March credit card purchases. Added by B&S on 5/5/23. Mar23 credit card purchases not reconciled until May.
 
8005 Charitable Contributions 
$600 increase to expense on on March credit card purchases. Add made by B&S on 5/5/23. Mar23 credit card purchases not reconciled until May.
 
All these items look like invoices entered in Bill.com that would sync to QB.
I would say that yes – Bill.com must have Alisa’s name, but I do NOT think she ever goes into the software.
 
There were older invoices that did not get to me until May, then entered.
These older invoices must not have been entered prior to our coming on board.
Soon as they come to my attention, I enter them into Bill.com with actual invoice dates.
 
Credit Cards had not been reconciled ever in QB, so the transactions went back into 2022.  
 
The only way to stop entry into closed books is for them to be locked down.
 
If we could have Admin rights, we would be able to lock them down so entries into prior months would not happen. But in an effort to get 2022 corrected and Q1 2023 correct – it does take time, and we were rushed to make close happen.

subject: RE: Reimbursement Process at LCW
body:
I am aware of that process but with the updated handbook and what Maria M presented at the retreat the below and this part of an email chain do not align.
 
Employee fills out the attached template with receipts and emails it to their manager for approval.
Once the manager approval is made via email, this email chain with the expense template and receipts will be sent to 
payablelcw@bill.com
 for processing, 
CC 
accounting@lcwmail.com
 so I can make sure it hits bill.com. We have been having issues with it not coming through to bill.com.
If the employee is new to bill.com, they will be requested to enter in their banking information for direct deposit reimbursement
IDEA - perhaps part of new employee on boarding they are set up in bill.com.
Accounting@lcwmail.com
 would need their name, copy of their w9, and an email
Then bill.com invites them to fill in their banking info.
Employee reimbursements are processed in the next payment cycle 
(15
th
 or 31
st
) 
from date of receipt. 
 
I’m asking to meet to clarify some questions before answering the staff’s questions and concerns. It would be easier to meet instead of emailing back and forth 
 
Briza Cardenas
(she/her/hers)
Chief of Staff, Office of the CEO
Email: 
b.cardenas@lcwmail.com
Phone: 773-938-3767 (CST)
 
   
www
 
|
 
Twitter
 
|
 
Facebook
 
|
 
LinkedIn
 
To inspire kindness, deepen understanding, and foster equity in the communities where people live and at the organizations where they work.

 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:

subject: Re: [DKIM Failure]  Q1 P&L results used for bank report
body:
5004.8 Trainer/Facilitator Fees 
$1500 increase to expense on NCB Feb23 bill no. 20230201. Change made by Alisa Kolodizner on 5/11/23
 
8004 Professional Fees 
$1050 increase to expense on Eisner Advisory Jan23 bill no. 1231262. Change made by Alisa Kolodizner on 5/12/23
 
7003.2 Computer Support 
$1206.25 increase to expense on TeamLogic Feb23 bills no. 1364 and 1371. Adds made by Alisa Kolodizner on 5/12/23
 
7004.02 Software Subscriptions 
$1001.93 increase to expense on Peerspace Inc Feb23 bill. Add made B&S on 5/5/23. Feb23 Credit card purchases not reconciled until May. 
 
6007.03 Hotels through 6007.08 Taxi/Ground 
$850.30 increase to expense on March credit card purchases. Added by B&S on 5/5/23. Mar23 credit card purchases not reconciled until May.
 
8005 Charitable Contributions 
$600 increase to expense on on March credit card purchases. Add made by B&S on 5/5/23. Mar23 credit card purchases not reconciled until May.
 
All these items look like invoices entered in Bill.com that would sync to QB.
I would say that yes – Bill.com must have Alisa’s name, but I do NOT think she ever goes into the software.
 
There were older invoices that did not get to me until May, then entered.
These older invoices must not have been entered prior to our coming on board.
Soon as they come to my attention, I enter them into Bill.com with actual invoice dates.
 
Credit Cards had not been reconciled ever in QB, so the transactions went back into 2022.  
 
The only way to stop entry into closed books is for them to be locked down.
 
If we could have Admin rights, we would be able to lock them down so entries into prior months would not happen. But in an effort to get 2022 corrected and Q1 2023 correct – it does take time, and we were rushed to make close happen.
 
 
Pamela Coulter
Accounting
 
Email: 
p.coulter@lcwmail.com
Mobile: 
+1.937.605.9970

From: 
Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com>
Date: 
Tuesday, May 30, 2023 at 11:18 PM
To: 
Rosie Herren <rosie@bookandstreet.com>
Cc: 
Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com>, Pamela Coulter <p.coulter@lcwmail.com>
Subject: 
Re: [DKIM Failure] Q1 P&L results used for bank report
Rosie - I’m not sure who is making those changes to the expenses but I can guarantee it’s not Alisa. She does not go into QBO. Let’s find out who is actually making those changes. 
Since it’s an increase to expense I’m going to go out on a limb and say it’s probably a change made in bill.com and the sync changes to QBO shows as Alisa making the changes even if it’s another user in bill.com.
 
Pam - can you confirm?
 
Michelle - are all of the bank and credit card reconciliations done through April?
 
Thank you,
Jennifer 
Sent from my iPhone
On May 30, 2023, at 5:58 PM, Rosie Herren <rosie@bookandstreet.com> wrote:
﻿ 
 
HI Jennifer
Understood. Just wanted to provide the option if you did want to do a JE since overall not a material net P&L change. Of the $13,355.90 change to the Q1 P&L I picked the largest items that changed and provided explanations on each below.
 
22,500 increase in total revenue
(28872.77) increase in expense 6003.3
(1500.00) increase in expense     5004.8
(1050.00) increase in expense     8004
(1206.25) increase in expense     7003.2
(1001.93) increase in expense     7004.02
($850.30) increase in expense     6007.03-6007.08
(600.00) increase in expense       8005
($12,581.25) net change to P&L explained (net loss increased)
 
Revenue
-total revenue increased $22500 which represented the amount of the 2022 BSC deferred revenue you had brought up that needed recognizing for Q1. We agreed with our finding.
 
6003.3 SIMPLE IRA – Match
 $28,872.77 increase to expense to get accrual correct at 3/31/23 (Due to 2022 ending accrual balance having debit balance of   $15,939.62. Should have been credit balance). 
 
5004.8 Trainer/Facilitator Fees

6007.03 Hotels through 6007.08 Taxi/Ground

8005 Charitable Contributions 
$600 increase to expense on on March credit card purchases. Add made by B&S on 5/5/23. Mar23 credit card purchases not reconciled until May.
 
Rosie

 Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com>; pamela@bookandstreet.com
Subject:
 Q1 P&L results used for bank report
 
Hi Jennifer,
If you can send me the financials or TB that was used as support for what was provided to your bank for Q1 I can run a comparison against what is showing in QB now for Q1. This will let me gather all P&L variances quickly between the two that I can summarize for you in one snapshort report.  Should be a much more efficient and faster  way to get at the differences. I believe the bulk of the variances will relate to payroll accruals, IRA/401k corrections and a few deferred revenue entries. Please advise. Thanks. 
 
Rosie

 credit card form
 
Hi Michelle and Jennifer,
 
We’ve just signed a new SOW for a training with our client Inter-American Development Bank, and they asked me to send over our credit card form, so that they can handle this payment using their corporate credit card. I’ve cut/paste the message below for clarity. Is this something we have readily that you can share? I understand that in the past, this client has paid with PayPal. The invoice was already created in Scoro and is ready to go…
 
Please let me know if you can share the credit card form, or if you need me to send a new request to the client.
 
Thank you!
Grace
 
“I hope you're doing well. To process the payment using our corporate credit card, we require a credit card form from LCW. To ensure a speedy processing of the payment, could you please provide us with the form today?”

Subject:
 Final reminder to submit ACA E-filing corrections for 2022
 
Submit ACA E-filing Corrections by May 31, 2023
  
 
Hello,
This is a final reminder that any corrections required for ACA for 2022 must be submitted by May 31, 2023 on TriNet Zenefits. E-filing will not be available in the ACA Compliance app after this date, however you'll still be able to access the app and the forms for paper filing. If you have “Accepted with Errors” or “Rejected” status showing up for your ACA filing, you can submit corrections by clicking on the Filing tab in the ACA Compliance app.
For more information on the most common ACA-related errors and how to fix them in your TriNet Zenefits ACA application, check out these 
Help Center articles
.
Filing is applicable only to companies that qualify as an 
Applicable Large Employer (ALE) or are part of an Aggregated Applicable Large Employer (AALE)
.
If you have any questions, please reach out to 
Zenefits Customer Care
.
Thanks,
TriNet Zenefits
 
Zenefits
  •   50 Beale St. San Francisco, CA, United States 94105

Almost forgot, the $384.03 credit should equal the 401k pull by the bank when the Vanguard, Chase or SSOPSTRUST type provider grabs the funds. Not sure who they use for that. 
 
Rosie
 
From: 
Rosie Herren <rosie@bookandstreet.com>
Date: 
Tuesday, May 30, 2023 at 11:37 AM
To: 
Story Accounting <story@bookandstreet.com>
Subject: 
Re: Help w This when you get a chance
See attached file.
 
Look in banking and send me detailed bank description of the $155.82 and $766.81 items. 
 
I believe first may be Gusto fee and latter may be payroll tax retund but without seeing the detailed bank info I can’t say yet. 
 
Any Gusto transactions that come over into banking with
 Cnd
 in the description are always contractors so I would code those directly to 7001 without bothering to even include in the payroll JE at all. 
 
 
Any Gusto transactions that come over into banking with
 Tran Fee
 in the description are always payroll processing fess so I would code those directly to payroll fees without bothering to even include in the payroll JE at all. 
 
 
If you do the above then your payroll JE will only be about  payroll wages that you are booking without having to worry about the contractors or fees muddying things up in your JE.
 
Rosie

Subject:
 Final reminder to submit ACA E-filing corrections for 2022
 
Submit ACA E-filing Corrections by May 31, 2023
  
 
Hello,
This is a final reminder that any corrections required for ACA for 2022 must be submitted by May 31, 2023 on TriNet Zenefits. E-filing will not be available in the ACA Compliance app after this date, however you'll still be able to access the app and the forms for paper filing. If you have “Accepted with Errors” or “Rejected” status showing up for your ACA filing, you can submit corrections by clicking on the Filing tab in the ACA Compliance app.
For more information on the most common ACA-related errors and how to fix them in your TriNet Zenefits ACA application, check out these 
Help Center articles
.
Filing is applicable only to companies that qualify as an 
Applicable Large Employer (ALE) or are part of an Aggregated Applicable Large Employer (AALE)
.
If you have any questions, please reach out to 
Zenefits Customer Care
.
Thanks,
TriNet Zenefits
 
Zenefits
  •   50 Beale St. San Francisco, CA, United States 94105

Subject:
 Final reminder to submit ACA E-filing corrections for 2022
 
Submit ACA E-filing Corrections by May 31, 2023
  
 
Hello,
This is a final reminder that any corrections required for ACA for 2022 must be submitted by May 31, 2023 on TriNet Zenefits. E-filing will not be available in the ACA Compliance app after this date, however you'll still be able to access the app and the forms for paper filing. If you have “Accepted with Errors” or “Rejected” status showing up for your ACA filing, you can submit corrections by clicking on the Filing tab in the ACA Compliance app.
For more information on the most common ACA-related errors and how to fix them in your TriNet Zenefits ACA application, check out these 
Help Center articles
.
Filing is applicable only to companies that qualify as an 
Applicable Large Employer (ALE) or are part of an Aggregated Applicable Large Employer (AALE)
.
If you have any questions, please reach out to 
Zenefits Customer Care
.
Thanks,
TriNet Zenefits
 
Zenefits

subject: Scoro Update: Roles on Quotes, Advanced Triggers and Actions
body:
Good news! Your Scoro site lcw.scoro.com has been updated! Get ready for a supercharged update! Our May version includes two hig...
 
 
 
Log in → 
 
Good news! Your Scoro site 
lcw.scoro.com
 has been updated!
Get ready for a supercharged update! Our May version includes two high-impact improvements that give you new superpowers in Scoro – read below how to unlock the full quote-to-cash flow with role prices and set up advanced automagical notifications! 
See what we’ve been up to!
Roles on quotes
At the end of last year, we added 
roles
 to Scoro, which let you 
define selling prices
 for team members based on their skill set, experience, responsibilities, or any other criteria. Now you can 
use role prices and role costs on quotes
 as well. This means roles now cover the whole project life cycle – you can seamlessly sell, track and bill your services with role prices.
If you've enabled roles, there’s a new 
Pricing method
 section in the quote modify view, where you can switch between role and service prices. If you opt for role prices, the unit price of the quoted service will be determined by the 
selling price of the role
. Furthermore, you can 
set up labor cost for roles
 to estimate your service delivery cost based on role and ensure a healthy margin, even if you don't know yet which team member will be delivering the service. 
Read more
 
Advanced triggers and actions
With 
Triggers and actions
, you can easily 
automate repetitive parts
 of your workflows and 
set up notifications
 about changes across the site that require your attention. Such automations help you save time and increase efficiency by eliminating mundane tasks and manual steps. 'Triggers and actions' now got an impressive makeover – we’ve updated the user interface as well as the setup logic.
As a result, ‘Triggers and actions’ are now 
more dynamic and support more complex rules
. In three simple steps, you can build different rules with the simple logic of “When this happens and these conditions apply, then do that”. To get you off the ground faster, we’ve compiled a list of ready-made templates which you can activate with just a few clicks. 
Read more
 
User lists and error logs for calendar integrations
To make it easier to manage calendar integrations globally and identify issues, admins can now track which users have connected their 
Google Calendar or MS Exchange
 accounts with Scoro’s calendar, and monitor sync errors. Head to the 'Users' tab under integration settings for a full overview of connected user accounts. The 'Logs' column and tab help you monitor if anyone has encountered issues with the setup. 
Read more
 
Upcoming Webinars
Live Webinar: 
Automate Your Workflows with Triggers and Actions
May 25th @ 15:00 BST / 10:00 ET / 17:00 EEST
Learn how to use the new and advanced 'Triggers and Actions' functionality to automate mundane tasks and streamline your workflows.
Hosted by:
 Lauma Kaugure, Head of Shared Services @ Scoro
Register here
 
Live Webinar: 
Introducing Role-Based Pricing Model in Scoro
Coming in June
Learn how to use and adapt the role-based pricing model throughout a project lifecycle in Scoro—from scoping a quote and delivering work, to billing and reporting!
Hosted by:
 Lauma Kaugure, Head of Shared Services @ Scoro
Registration details to follow
 
See our blog post for more details
.
We do our very best to make Scoro better every day, so we really appreciate your feedback. Let us know what you think at 
help@scoro.com
.
Yours truly,
Team Scoro
 
 
 
© 2023 Scoro Software. | 
www.scoro.com
 
Scoro Software Ltd | The Frames, 1 Phipp Street, EC2A 4PS | London, United Kingdom 
If you need assistance or have any questions, please contact our 
Customer Support
.

Subject:
 Final reminder to submit ACA E-filing corrections for 2022
 
Submit ACA E-filing Corrections by May 31, 2023
  
 
Hello,
This is a final reminder that any corrections required for ACA for 2022 must be submitted by May 31, 2023 on TriNet Zenefits. E-filing will not be available in the ACA Compliance app after this date, however you'll still be able to access the app and the forms for paper filing. If you have “Accepted with Errors” or “Rejected” status showing up for your ACA filing, you can submit corrections by clicking on the Filing tab in the ACA Compliance app.
For more information on the most common ACA-related errors and how to fix them in your TriNet Zenefits ACA application, check out these 
Help Center articles
.
Filing is applicable only to companies that qualify as an 
Applicable Large Employer (ALE) or are part of an Aggregated Applicable Large Employer (AALE)
.
If you have any questions, please reach out to 
Zenefits Customer Care
.
Thanks,
TriNet Zenefits

subject: Re: [DKIM Failure]  Final reminder to submit ACA E-filing corrections for 2022
body:
Someone with Zenefits access has to do it. We can try on Tuesday to see what compliance questions need to be answered though the Trinet email message from Alisa says the deadline is 5/31 for "corrections". The below excerpt talks about what ACA compliance involves (from doing a general search on Google).  
We'll have to contact Trinet Customer Care on Tuesday to assist if necessary. We have the Trinet Customer Care link at the bottom of Alisa's email.
Rosie
Small businesses are those with fewer than 50 full-time employees. ACA reporting compliance for employers with fewer than 50 employees requires them to provide information about the Marketplace to their employees, regardless of whether they plan on offering health

subject: Re: Cash forecast
body:
Apologies, didn’t address Voya.  Mostly related to change in submission process (and initially no instructions on how to submit invoices through the portal), and lack of funds on the POs under which the services were delivered.
 
There have been multiple issues with Voya:
 
They transitioned from email to an accounting portal.  
Dan changed the invoices after they were initially prepared based on changes to purchase orders, as I understand.
I submitted an invoice through the portal without the attachment, which caused a delay.
I re-submitted the invoice today but with the wrong value ($5K vs. $8K), and have reached back to them to correct the value.
The remaining invoice sitting in Compass is booked to a PO that does not have significant funds available.  Dan is aware and it’s in his hands to get the amount of the PO increased.  I forwarded it to the invoicing group at Voya to see if they can increase the value of the PO.
 
 
Michelle Murcia
Accounting, 
LCW

From:

Sent:
 Tuesday, May 23, 2023 12:21 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Final reminder to submit ACA E-filing corrections for 2022
 
Submit ACA E-filing Corrections by May 31, 2023
  
 
Hello,
This is a final reminder that any corrections required for ACA for 2022 must be submitted by May 31, 2023 on TriNet Zenefits. E-filing will not be available in the ACA Compliance app after this date, however you'll still be able to access the app and the forms for paper filing. If you have “Accepted with Errors” or “Rejected” status showing up for your ACA filing, you can submit corrections by clicking on the Filing tab in the ACA Compliance app.
For more information on the most common ACA-related errors and how to fix them in your TriNet Zenefits ACA application, check out these 
Help Center articles
.
Filing is applicable only to companies that qualify as an 
Applicable Large Employer (ALE) or are part of an Aggregated Applicable Large Employer (AALE)
.
If you have any questions, please reach out to 
Zenefits Customer Care
.
Thanks,
TriNet Zenefits
 
Zenefits
  •   50 Beale St. San Francisco, CA, United States 94105

Subject: 
Employee Reimbursement Process
Hi Pam – I hope you had a great weekend. I don’t know if you have met Maria Mercado yet. 
Yes, we worked on Hartford Workers Comp Audit! 
Maria is HR for LCW. Starting tomorrow, LCW is meeting for a companywide retreat and Maria is presenting on the steps on how to get reimbursed for expenses for employees. I don’t know the process so I’m hoping you can help fill in the blanks here:
 
Employee fills out the attached template with receipts and emails it to their manager for approval.
Once the manager approval is made via email, this email chain with the expense template and receipts will be sent to 
payablelcw@bill.com
 for processing, 
CC 
accounting@lcwmail.com
 so I can make sure it hits bill.com. We have been having issues with it not coming through to bill.com.
If the employee is new to bill.com, they will be requested to enter in their banking information for direct deposit reimbursement
IDEA - perhaps part of new employee on boarding they are set up in bill.com.
Accounting@lcwmail.com
 would need their name, copy of their w9, and an email
Then bill.com invites them to fill in their banking info.
Employee reimbursements are processed in the next payment cycle 
(15
th
 or 31
st
) 
from date of receipt. 
 
@Pamela Coulter
 what is the process for employees using their corporate cards? Do they submit their expenses to their manager for approval only? Is there a process on this?
 
I would have them fill out similar form for credit cards as expense reimbursement, send to manager for approval and cc 
accounting@lcwmail.com
.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer
 
------------------------------------------------------
Jennifer Barbieri
LCW 
100 S Saunders Rd, Suite 150
Lake Forest, IL 60045

subject: FW: Your Collection Letter is Available Online
body:
Pam, do you have the login details?  I assume this is for unpaid insurance.  If not, please call the number to get the information.  Looks like it’s gone to collections.
 
 
Michelle Murcia
Accounting, 
LCW 
Email: 
m.murcia@lcwmail.com
Mobile: +1.614.546.8422
 
   
www
 
|
 
Twitter
 
|
 
Facebook
 
|
 
LinkedIn
 
 
To inspire kindness, deepen understanding, and
foster equity in the communities where people
live and at the organizations where they work.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
From: 
thesource@jfs.ohio.gov <thesource@jfs.ohio.gov>
Date: 
Friday, May 19, 2023 at 2:05 PM
To: 
Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject: 
Your Collection Letter is Available Online
Please log in to your unemployment account at https://unemployment.ohio.gov to view your Collection Letter. 
If you have any questions about this communication, please contact the Office of Unemployment
Insurance Operations at 614-466-2319
*Please do not reply to this e-mail as this mailbox is not monitored.*

subject: FW: New LCW Credit Cards
body:
Please review the email below and review the submitted expense reports submitted since January 2023.  I believe there should be significant amounts billable to clients.  I’d like to review this week so we can bill the customers.
 
 
From: 
Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Date: 
Sunday, February 26, 2023 at 1:52 PM
To: 
Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Cc: 
Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Subject: 
FW: New LCW Credit Cards
This is the expense report consultants are asked to submit when they use the LCW credit cards. Please review credit card activity to ensure all expenses are tied to a client, billed to the client appropriately and/or expense type.

 CLT <clt@lcwmail.com>; XLT <xlt@lcwmail.com>; Jeffrey Cookson <j.cookson@lcwmail.com>; Larry Baker <l.baker@lcwmail.com>; Alsu Schondelmayer <a.schondelmayer@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Briza Cardenas <b.cardenas@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: New LCW Credit Cards
 
Hello all,
 
Regarding the below credit card info, 
attached please find the Excel spreadsheet to be submitted to Alsu on the 1
st
 & 15
th
 of each month.
This is to be used for all your expenses – namely, things being billed to clients (like travel) and things put on your card for internal LCW use (such as paying for Google Ads, IDIs, etc.). This card is to be used for business-related expenses only (no personal charges).
 
Please read the instructions on the attached carefully. Should you have any questions about using the form, please reach out to Alsu for assistance. 
 
Kindly note the following:
 
Use the SUMMARY tab 
only 
– do not enter anything into the other tabs
On the SUMMARY tab, check “CASH” if for some reason you end up using a personal card; check “BILL” if anything on the spreadsheet is billed to the client (no matter what card is used); and do not check either if the charges are internal (not client-related) on your LCW card & not client related (Google Ads, Scoro, SurveyMonkey, etc.)
For internal charges, use the description field to enter the purchase details and enter the dollar amount under MISC; leave CLIENT blank & put “Internal” in the SOW area
For travel charges, enter all client details at the top and enter all travel costs under their appropriate column (air, taxi, etc.)
Do not edit this document
 
Please start using this as soon as you begin using your LCW card. Ideally, everyone with an LCW credit card will be using this spreadsheet & submitting to Alsu on the 1
st
 of August.
 
Thanks so much!
Nicole
 
Nicole Barile
Director of Operations
, 
LCW

Subject:
 New LCW Credit Cards
 
Good morning! As you all should have heard by now, you are each going to receive (or have received) a new LCW credit card this week. You can use the card for all approved LCW-related charges. Please speak with your manager for more details if needed.
 
All 
subscriptions
 will be put on Briza’s card (Survey Monkey, Dropbox, LinkedIn, etc.). All other 
“one-off”
 charges (including client-specific travel charges) will be put on your credit card. If you manage people, your team has been instructed to reach out to you (see below) should they need something put on a card.
 
All credit card holders will be required to submit a summary of all expenses/credit card charges to Alsu every 1
st
 & 15
th
 of the month. We will have a spreadsheet for you to use soon. 
 
As a reminder, you can find travel policies in the PROCESSES LIBRARY. I’ll be updating travel policies in the Employee Handbook soon as well.
 
Please let me know if you have any questions.
Thank you!
 
Nicole Barile
Director of Operations
, 
LCW

Subject:
 Credit card usage
 
Good morning everyone!
If you are on this email chain, it’s my understanding that you use a credit card for subscriptions and/or purchasing things from time to time (like IDI licenses).
 
In an attempt to simplify things & better keep track of operational costs, we are going to put all
 subscriptions
 onto a new credit card that Briza will own. In other words, if you are currently putting subscriptions on your card, those things will go on Briza’s card, and your LCW credit card will not be renewed.
 
If you use a credit card for 
one-off purchases
, those can be put on your manager’s card. In most cases, you should be able to store the credit card on file so that you do not need to request the card info every time. You can work with your manager to find the best way to simplify the process.
 
In sum:
Subscriptions: 
Going on Briza’s LCW credit card
One-off purchases: 
Going on your manager’s credit card
 
Briza & I will work with you to transition things to this new card.
 
Thanks in advance for your help & patience with this!
Nicole & Briza

body:
Hi Pamela,
 
I looked into the other consultants’ records. There are (3) total payments from 2023 due from LCW to Brian Schroeder.
$1,000 Jan 2023 Fleishman Hillard (paid)
$1,500 Jan 2023 J&J (Unpaid)
$1,500 Feb 2023 J&J (Unpaid)
 
If you refer to the attachments I sent this morning, you will see two separate invoices for $1,500, neither of which have been paid. LCW paid Brian $1,000 for a different project. LCW still owes Brian $3,000, which is the sum of the two unpaid invoices.
 
Please confirm that LCW will pay Brian $3,000 on May 15.
 
Thank you,
 
Dan

body:
Can you meet with Maria to get the required information into the Portal?  She is available at 3pm Eastern tomorrow (they’re on Central time).
 
M

Thank you,
Maria

 Friday, May 5, 2023 2:24 PM

 Maria Mercado <m.mercado@lcwmail.com>; Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>; Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: Hartford Insurance audit 
 
Do you want to find a time to meet with Pam to walk through it?
 
From: 
Maria Mercado <m.mercado@lcwmail.com>
Date: 
Friday, May 5, 2023 at 2:18 PM
To: 
Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com>, Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>, Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject: 
Re: Hartford Insurance audit 
Hi Michelle, 
 
It's not a form, the audit is done online in the Hartford portal. Unfortunately it can't be downloaded and it's one of those types where you have to input information as you go to get to the next step. I went through all of the steps to see what info was needed and it asks for payroll information and for tax forms we submitted.
 
Thank you,
Maria

Michelle Murcia

subject: [Language & Culture Worldwide] [Confirmation] Zenefits just finished processing your pay run
body:
Hi Payroll Admin, 
Language & Culture Worldwide's last scheduled pay run Payroll run for Apr 02-16 is now complete.
 
Here's a quick recap of your pay run: 
Zenefits debited your company bank account ending in 6303 for $76,965.54 on Apr. 26, 2023. 
You paid 28 employee(s) today for the Apr. 2, 2023–Apr. 16, 2023 pay period. 
For more details about this pay run, log in to Zenefits 
here

subject: Amortization Schedules?
body:
Pam,
 
Do we have amortization schedules for these assets?
 
I’m not seeing any quarterly expense related to the amortization for Q1.

subject: Accrued 2022 Bonuses
body:
Pam,
 
Looks like there were bonuses accrued in 2022 (see attached) that should have been part of the journal entry for the bonus payments made in Q1.  This activity would be picked up in the balance sheet reconciliation process.
 
Please work with Rosie make an entry to match the bonus payments made in Q1 so that expense is not overstated and to relieve the accrual.

subject: Payroll Liabilities
body: We’ve got amounts hitting the Payroll Liabilities account at the master level, and not understanding how the other accounts net.

subject: Payroll Tax Liability Account
body: Something isn’t working with our JEs.  The balance in the Payroll Tax Liability account is growing…

subject: Re: Payroll Liability Account
body:
Same with the Simple IRA – see attached.

subject: Credit Memo Needed
body: Pam, can you create a credit memo dated 11/21/11 for this overpayment by Diligent that was applied as an offset to accounts receivable.  I moved it to 2301 Deferred Revenue, but it should really be a credit memo for Diligent and applied to a future invoice.  I will communicate with the consultant and Randy (who made the entry to offset AR) to make sure we haven’t already applied a credit to an invoice, but in the meantime, this should be booked as a credit memo in QB.  Thanks.

I’m guessing there’s a history here, Jennifer, so let us know.
 
Our process is to call to confirm the wire information prior to setting it up.  Did the check clear or was it returned?  
 
We use Bill.com to ensure that the vendors are setting up their own wire details.  He has provided them on a new invoice when he previously declined electronic payment, which is concerning.
 
Does he have his phone number on both invoices and is it the same?

subject: Re: MCO open enrollment is next month, Medical and Health Symposium, and more!
body:
From: 
Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Date: 
Wednesday, April 26, 2023 at 11:06 PM
To: 
Pamela Coulter <p.coulter@lcwmail.com>
Subject: 
FW: MCO open enrollment is next month, Medical and Health Symposium, and more!
Do you know who the MCO is for LCW in Ohio?
 
From: 
Ohio Bureau of Workers' Compensation <OhioBWC@public.govdelivery.com>
Date: 
Wednesday, April 26, 2023 at 1:32 PM
To: 
Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject: 
MCO open enrollment is next month, Medical and Health Symposium, and more!
 
Having trouble viewing this email? 
View it as a Web page
.
 
 
 
 
MCO open enrollment May 1–26
Employers, your opportunity to choose the managed care organization (MCO) to manage
the medical portion of your workers’ compensation claims is just around the corner. BWC’s
2023 MCO open enrollment begins at 7:30 a.m. Monday, May 1, and ends at 5:30 p.m.
Friday, May 26.
To help you select an MCO that meets the needs of your business and workers, updated
versions of BWC’s 
MCO Selection Guide
 and 
MCO Report Card
 are available at
bwc.ohio.gov
. The guide walks you through the selection process, while the report
card provides up-to-date MCO performance information. If you’re satisfied with your MCO,
you don’t need to do anything.
 
Medical and Health Symposium
Registration is now open
 for the 
Medical & Health Symposium May 4 – 6! 
Our free, award-winning symposium is once again virtual and can be attended online.
 
 
Leading state and national experts
 
We will offer sessions on the latest health principles in occupational medicine, disability etiquette and inclusion, empathy in healthcare, the importance of mental health, BWC administrative processes and treatment programs, and more. You can even watch a live shoulder surgery! 
The symposium also offers 
free continuing education
 for many healthcare and legal professionals. Once again, we will host a virtual exhibitor hall for healthcare-related companies to showcase their products and services. 
Contact info, exhibitor opportunities  
 
If you know any healthcare or legal professionals who may want to attend, please help spread the word and encourage them to register. If you have questions or know an organization or employer who might be interested in exhibiting, email us at 
medsymposium@bwc.state.oh.us
. 
 
 
Private Employer Policy Year 2023 Notice
 
In late April and early May,  BWC will begin mailing information regarding the Estimated Annual Premium for the policy year beginning July 1, 2023. The letter will include the payroll estimate, installment schedule, and premium information for the next policy year. It will also included an updated certificate of coverage for active policies.
If an employer needs to change any information for the upcoming policy year, please call 1-800-644-6292.
The annual notice is not a bill and installments should not be made upon receiving the notice. An invoice will be mailed on June 1, 2023.
 
News Briefs
Multiple Policy Payment Option
 
We have made it easier than ever to do business with BWC. If you provide services for multiple clients, you may now submit a single payment for all of your clients. 
To access this new feature, sign in with an authorized representative account associated with a representative id. If you do not have a representative id you can obtain one by submitting a completed 
R-4 form.
Click here
 for more information.
April edition of Safety Update
Check out 
the latest news
 from safety and health experts from BWC, NIOSH, and OSHA.
Important dates
April 27: 
Monthly Employer Update Webinar. 
More info online.
April 27:
 Webinar: Stand-Down to Prevent Falls in Construction. 
More info online.
May 4-6:
 2023 Medical and Health Symposium. 
More info online.
May 9:
 In-Person Training - Ergonomics: Basic Principles. 
More info online.
May 11:
 In-person Training - OSHA Recordkeeping Half-day Workshop. 
More info online.
May 18: 
Better You, Better Ohio! wellness webinar. 
More info online.
May 31:
 Employer program application deadline. 
More info online.
 
Ohio Bureau of Workers’ Compensation
Vision: 
To transform BWC into an agile organization driven by customer success. 
Mission: 
To deliver consistently excellent experiences for each BWC customer every day. 
Core Values: 
One Agency, Personal Connection, Innovative Leadership, Relentless Excellence.
Established in 1912, the Ohio Bureau of Workers’ Compensation is the exclusive provider of workers’ compensation insurance in Ohio, serving 257,000 public and private employers. With nearly 1,600 employees and assets of approximately $21 billion, BWC is one of the largest state-run insurance systems in the United States. For more, visit 
www.bwc.ohio.gov
.
 
 
Stay Connected with Ohio Bureau of Workers' Compensation:
  
  
  
  
  
SUBSCRIBER SERVICES:
Manage Subscriptions
  |  
Help

subject: Re: Payables
body:
Pam is doing a quick analysis of the situation, but it seems like several vendors are saying they received duplicate payments.  Most of them are PayPal.  
 
In the reconciliation process we also identified that the PayPal payments syncing from Bill.com seem to be mapping to the Citi account vs. the PayPal account (which also doesn’t show up on the banking panel as an account).  
 
We will be putting together the PPF today for approval and payment tomorrow, but still not sure what’s really happening between Bill.com and PP.
 
Pam should have those issues identified this afternoon, but likely not until after we meet to review the balance sheet.  Hope you’re available at 1:45!
 
 
Michelle Murcia

The letter will include the payroll estimate, installment schedule, and premium information for the next policy year. It will also included an updated certificate of coverage for active policies.
If an employer needs to change any information for the upcoming policy year, please call 1-800-644-6292.
The annual notice is not a bill and installments should not be made upon receiving the notice. An invoice will be mailed on June 1, 2023.
 
News Briefs
Multiple Policy Payment Option
 
We have made it easier than ever to do business with BWC. If you provide services for multiple clients, you may now submit a single payment for all of your clients. 
To access this new feature, sign in with an authorized representative account associated with a representative id. If you do not have a representative id you can obtain one by submitting a completed 
R-4 form.
Click here
 for more information.

Check out 
the latest news
 from safety and health experts from BWC, NIOSH, and OSHA.

Better You, Better Ohio! wellness webinar.

Ohio Bureau of Workers’ Compensation
Vision: 
To transform BWC into an agile organization driven by customer success. 
Mission: 
To deliver consistently excellent experiences for each BWC customer every day. 
Core Values: 
One Agency, Personal Connection, Innovative Leadership, Relentless Excellence.
Established in 1912, the Ohio Bureau of Workers’ Compensation is the exclusive provider of workers’ compensation insurance in Ohio, serving 257,000 public and private employers. With nearly 1,600 employees and assets of approximately $21 billion, BWC is one of the largest state-run insurance systems in the United States. For more, visit 
www.bwc.ohio.gov
.

subject: Last Chance to Register
body:
Experience four days of content designed exclusively for businesses like yours ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Celebrating businesses like yours 
with can’t-miss content
Hi 
Pamela,
‌
Our National Small Business Week Summit is May 1-4 and you still have time to register to take advantage of the amazing content we have available to you—broken into 2 sessions per day so you can enjoy them without disrupting your work day.
‌
RSVP here
‌
This is TriNet’s second annual National Small Business Week Summit, in which we honor the entrepreneurs who play such a big part in bringing new ideas to life and growing our economy by creating and sharing content designed exclusively for businesses like yours.
‌
You won’t find expert advice and information like this anywhere else!
‌
This year’s sessions include:
Mastering Compensation Strategies in 2023
How SMBs Can Take Advantage of R&D Tax Credits
From Reactive to Proactive: Digitalization's Impact on SMB
HR Compliance Pitfalls and How to Avoid Them
Unlocking Accelerated Growth in the U.S. & Globally
Is HR Debt Crushing You
Piecing Together the Talent Puzzle: Four Truths About Finding and Keeping Talent
Demystifying Cybersecurity and Updating the Human Firewall
‌
And much more!
‌
Don’t miss out. This is your last chance to join us for an incredible SMB event.
‌
RSVP Today

subject: Scoro Update: Smoother Time Tracking and Jira Integration
body:
Good news! Your Scoro site lcw.scoro.com has been updated! Ever wondered where your time goes? Scoro’s excellent time tracking c...
 
 
 
Log in → 
 
Good news! Your Scoro site 
lcw.scoro.com
 has been updated!
Ever wondered where your time goes? Scoro’s excellent time tracking capabilities help you solve that mystery! This month we are tweaking the quick access to our Time Tracker so you could incorporate it into your workflows even more seamlessly. Prefer to track your time in Jira? No problem, our brand new Jira integration has got you covered! 
See what we’ve been up to!
Time Tracker improvements
Scoro’s Time Tracker helps you log time automatically as you’re working on assignments. You can open it conveniently from any view, using the quick actions menu in the top right corner. We’ve now equipped it with another shortcut – the 
Add time entry
 button, so you can log chunks of work directly from the tracker. Moreover, you can now close time entries with less effort as we brought the 
Mark as done
 button out of hiding and into full view for instant access. Another click eliminated, another second saved! 
Read more
 
Task duration in the Gantt chart
You can now fine-tune your project plan on the Gantt chart quicker – 
task duration is now editable
 directly in the chart view. Just double-click on the duration field, update the value, and voilà! But remember – you still need to click the 
Save
 button for the changes to take effect. In addition, project phases are now visually more distinguishable from tasks, so you can easily grasp the project structure at a glance and tweak it as needed. 
Read more
 
Jira integration
Exciting news for all Jira users – we’ve launched the 
beta version of our Jira integration
! Set up the connection to reap the benefits of Scoro’s powerful planning, invoicing and reporting capabilities without upending your tried and tested workflows in Jira. Your team members can continue managing their tasks and time in Jira like they’re used to, while all the logged minutes get seamlessly synced to Scoro. You can then use that data in Scoro to monitor budgets, invoice clients, generate reports, track utilization and productivity metrics, etc. 
Drop us an email
 and we’ll help you set up the integration! 
Read more
 
Smart export for Quotes
You can now decide which data you want to export from the quotes list. Customize the list view with various filters and view options, then tick the rows you want to export and pick the option to 
Export only the displayed columns
. The displayed data columns will be exported in the exact same order as you see them in Scoro. So no need to invest extra time into data cleanup post-export – simply extract only the data you actually need! 
Read more
 
See our blog post for more details
.
We do our very best to make Scoro better every day, so we really appreciate your feedback. Let us know what you think at 
help@scoro.com
.
Yours truly,
Team Scoro
 
 
 
© 2023 Scoro Software. | 
www.scoro.com
 
Scoro Software Ltd | The Frames, 1 Phipp Street, EC2A 4PS | London, United Kingdom 
If you need assistance or have any questions, please contact our 
Customer Support
.

Hi

National Small Business week is quickly approaching, and we want to give you a look at some of what we have planned for you at our Second Annual National Small Business Week Summit.

RSVP here
 and check out our amazing content for this year.

From:
 Sondra Jones <
sondra.sj.jones@gmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 22, 2023 8:38 PM
To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Interested in sponsoring Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe event?
 
Dear Rebecca, 
 
We’re reaching out to you on behalf of Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe (FPGB) Elementary’s PTA. FPGB is a dual language public school committed to developing bilingual and biliterate students who are prepared to engage, contribute, and lead in the communities that surround them, both near and far. 
 
On May 5, 2023, FPGB will be hosting an exciting event — Copa Mundial (World Cup) — a school-wide soccer tournament that will include an opening ceremony and a fan festival with music, games, and activities. Based on the success of our past events, we expect Copa Mundial to attract 
more than 600 attendees. 
We appreciate Language & Culture Worldwide's generous sponsorship of past FPGB events and would love to partner with you again this year
. 
 
We offer the following sponsorship opportunities:
 
Tournament Sponsors ($200) and Festival Sponsors ($100)
 receive the following benefits:
Tournament Sponsors
: 
Logo on banners that will be carried by students in the parade and displayed on the sidelines during the tournament
Sponsorship announced by the emcee during the parade
Festival Sponsors
: 
Logo on a large display thanking Festival Sponsors at the entrance to the Fan Festival
Logo in proximity to one game or activity
All Sponsors
: 
B&W logo in the event program and in the school newspaper
Logo included on a large display, promoting the event and thanking sponsors, outside school during the weeks leading up to the event and at the entrance to the event on May 5th
 
Event Sponsors ($300)
 receive all of the benefits of Tournament and Festival Sponsors. In addition, for the remainder of 2023, we will acknowledge your sponsorship by displaying your logo in the FPGB lobby and your logo with website link on our PTA website (
http://fpgpta.org
). 
 
Contributions can be paid online at 
http://fpgpta.org/copa-mundial-sponsor-form
 or via check to “FPGB PTA” with “Copa Mundial Sponsor” in the memo. Please submit your high-resolution logo (2MB) through that online form or by email to our treasurer, Christina Burch, at 
treasurer@fpgpta.org
. In return, we will send your tax deductible receipt, a photo of your logo on display at our Copa Mundial event, and a copy of the event program that features your logo. Thank you for your sponsorship and for making our school and community part of your business.
 
Sincerely,
Sondra Jones
PTA Volunteer
Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe Elementary
 
Mail sponsorship payments to:
Frank Porter Graham PTA 
101 Smith Level Rd.
Chapel Hill, NC 27516
http://fpgpta.org
 
919-942-6491
The FPGB PTA is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organized under the North Carolina PTA, and your sponsorship of our Copa Mundial event is tax deductible. 
The FPGB PTA Tax ID # is 58-1595686.
