From:
 Sondra Jones <
sondra.sj.jones@gmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 22, 2023 8:38 PM
To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Interested in sponsoring Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe event?
 
Dear Rebecca, 
 
We’re reaching out to you on behalf of Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe (FPGB) Elementary’s PTA. FPGB is a dual language public school committed to developing bilingual and biliterate students who are prepared to engage, contribute, and lead in the communities that surround them, both near and far. 
 
On May 5, 2023, FPGB will be hosting an exciting event — Copa Mundial (World Cup) — a school-wide soccer tournament that will include an opening ceremony and a fan festival with music, games, and activities. Based on the success of our past events, we expect Copa Mundial to attract 
more than 600 attendees. 
We appreciate Language & Culture Worldwide's generous sponsorship of past FPGB events and would love to partner with you again this year
. 
 
We offer the following sponsorship opportunities:
 
Tournament Sponsors ($200) and Festival Sponsors ($100)
 receive the following benefits:
Tournament Sponsors
: 
Logo on banners that will be carried by students in the parade and displayed on the sidelines during the tournament
Sponsorship announced by the emcee during the parade
Festival Sponsors
: 
Logo on a large display thanking Festival Sponsors at the entrance to the Fan Festival
Logo in proximity to one game or activity
All Sponsors
: 
B&W logo in the event program and in the school newspaper
Logo included on a large display, promoting the event and thanking sponsors, outside school during the weeks leading up to the event and at the entrance to the event on May 5th
 
Event Sponsors ($300)
 receive all of the benefits of Tournament and Festival Sponsors. In addition, for the remainder of 2023, we will acknowledge your sponsorship by displaying your logo in the FPGB lobby and your logo with website link on our PTA website (
http://fpgpta.org
). 
 
Contributions can be paid online at 
http://fpgpta.org/copa-mundial-sponsor-form
 or via check to “FPGB PTA” with “Copa Mundial Sponsor” in the memo. Please submit your high-resolution logo (2MB) through that online form or by email to our treasurer, Christina Burch, at 
treasurer@fpgpta.org
. In return, we will send your tax deductible receipt, a photo of your logo on display at our Copa Mundial event, and a copy of the event program that features your logo. Thank you for your sponsorship and for making our school and community part of your business.
 
Sincerely,
Sondra Jones
PTA Volunteer
Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe Elementary
 
Mail sponsorship payments to:
Frank Porter Graham PTA 
101 Smith Level Rd.
Chapel Hill, NC 27516
http://fpgpta.org
 
919-942-6491
The FPGB PTA is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organized under the North Carolina PTA, and your sponsorship of our Copa Mundial event is tax deductible. 
The FPGB PTA Tax ID # is 58-1595686.

 receive the following benefits:
Tournament Sponsors
: 
Logo on banners that will be carried by students in the parade and displayed on the sidelines during the tournament
Sponsorship announced by the emcee during the parade
Festival Sponsors
: 
Logo on a large display thanking Festival Sponsors at the entrance to the Fan Festival
Logo in proximity to one game or activity
All Sponsors
: 
B&W logo in the event program and in the school newspaper
Logo included on a large display, promoting the event and thanking sponsors, outside school during the weeks leading up to the event and at the entrance to the event on May 5th
 
Event Sponsors ($300)
 receive all of the benefits of Tournament and Festival Sponsors. In addition, for the remainder of 2023, we will acknowledge your sponsorship by displaying your logo in the FPGB lobby and your logo with website link on our PTA website (
http://fpgpta.org
). 
 
Contributions can be paid online at 
http://fpgpta.org/copa-mundial-sponsor-form
 or via check to “FPGB PTA” with “Copa Mundial Sponsor” in the memo. Please submit your high-resolution logo (2MB) through that online form or by email to our treasurer, Christina Burch, at 
treasurer@fpgpta.org
. In return, we will send your tax deductible receipt, a photo of your logo on display at our Copa Mundial event, and a copy of the event program that features your logo. Thank you for your sponsorship and for making our school and community part of your business.
 
Sincerely,
Sondra Jones
PTA Volunteer
Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe Elementary
 
Mail sponsorship payments to:
Frank Porter Graham PTA 
101 Smith Level Rd.
Chapel Hill, NC 27516
http://fpgpta.org
 
919-942-6491
The FPGB PTA is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organized under the North Carolina PTA, and your sponsorship of our Copa Mundial event is tax deductible. 
The FPGB PTA Tax ID # is 58-1595686.

Subject:
 Interested in sponsoring Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe event?
 
Dear Rebecca, 
 
We’re reaching out to you on behalf of Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe (FPGB) Elementary’s PTA. FPGB is a dual language public school committed to developing bilingual and biliterate students who are prepared to engage, contribute, and lead in the communities that surround them, both near and far. 
 
On May 5, 2023, FPGB will be hosting an exciting event — Copa Mundial (World Cup) — a school-wide soccer tournament that will include an opening ceremony and a fan festival with music, games, and activities. Based on the success of our past events, we expect Copa Mundial to attract 
more than 600 attendees. 
We appreciate Language & Culture Worldwide's generous sponsorship of past FPGB events and would love to partner with you again this year
. 
 
We offer the following sponsorship opportunities:
 
Tournament Sponsors ($200) and Festival Sponsors ($100)
 receive the following benefits:
Tournament Sponsors
: 
Logo on banners that will be carried by students in the parade and displayed on the sidelines during the tournament
Sponsorship announced by the emcee during the parade
Festival Sponsors
: 
Logo on a large display thanking Festival Sponsors at the entrance to the Fan Festival
Logo in proximity to one game or activity
All Sponsors
: 
B&W logo in the event program and in the school newspaper
Logo included on a large display, promoting the event and thanking sponsors, outside school during the weeks leading up to the event and at the entrance to the event on May 5th
 
Event Sponsors ($300)
 receive all of the benefits of Tournament and Festival Sponsors. In addition, for the remainder of 2023, we will acknowledge your sponsorship by displaying your logo in the FPGB lobby and your logo with website link on our PTA website (
http://fpgpta.org
). 
 
Contributions can be paid online at 
http://fpgpta.org/copa-mundial-sponsor-form
 or via check to “FPGB PTA” with “Copa Mundial Sponsor” in the memo. Please submit your high-resolution logo (2MB) through that online form or by email to our treasurer, Christina Burch, at 
treasurer@fpgpta.org
. In return, we will send your tax deductible receipt, a photo of your logo on display at our Copa Mundial event, and a copy of the event program that features your logo. Thank you for your sponsorship and for making our school and community part of your business.
 
Sincerely,
Sondra Jones
PTA Volunteer
Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe Elementary
 
Mail sponsorship payments to:
Frank Porter Graham PTA 
101 Smith Level Rd.
Chapel Hill, NC 27516
http://fpgpta.org
 
919-942-6491
The FPGB PTA is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organized under the North Carolina PTA, and your sponsorship of our Copa Mundial event is tax deductible. 
The FPGB PTA Tax ID # is 58-1595686.

Payment Due – Final Notice
 
 
 
Dear Alisa, 
 
We want to let you know that your State Mandated DBL/PFL Policy canceled on 03/18/2023 because we never received your premium payment. We’ve made several attempts to collect the premium due. If we don’t receive payment or a formal request for cancelation by 04/18/2023, your account will be placed with our collection agency. 
 
Payment is outstanding for: 
 
Customer Name
Customer #
Invoice #
Billing Period
LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE LLC
016891030001
231323131405
10/01/2022-12/31/2022
 
What Happens Next? 
 
Your policy is now canceled. If you meant to cancel your policy, please send a detailed request in writing to your Hartford Representative. Be sure to include your reason for the cancelation and the date you would like it to be effective. 
 
If you didn’t mean to cancel your policy, submit your payment as soon as possible. You may 
login to Employer View
®
 to view your account, but you won’t be able to make a payment online. 
 
You may send your check to: 
 
Remittance Address
The Hartford
P.O. Box 783690
Philadelphia, PA 19178-3690
 
Overnight Address
The Hartford
LOCKBOX 3690, MAC Y1372-045
401 Market Street
Philadelphia, PA 19106
 
 
View Your Bill »
 
 
 
Please be sure to include your customer number and invoice number with your payment so we can process it as fast as possible. If you need help, contact our Group Benefits Service Center at 800-454-7020. 
 
Thank you. 
 
The Hartford Group Benefits Service Center
gbdcustomerservice@thehartford.com
 
800-454-7020

From:
 Sondra Jones <
sondra.sj.jones@gmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 22, 2023 8:38 PM
To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Interested in sponsoring Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe event?
 
Dear Rebecca, 
 
We’re reaching out to you on behalf of Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe (FPGB) Elementary’s PTA. FPGB is a dual language public school committed to developing bilingual and biliterate students who are prepared to engage, contribute, and lead in the communities that surround them, both near and far. 
 
On May 5, 2023, FPGB will be hosting an exciting event — Copa Mundial (World Cup) — a school-wide soccer tournament that will include an opening ceremony and a fan festival with music, games, and activities. Based on the success of our past events, we expect Copa Mundial to attract 
more than 600 attendees. 
We appreciate Language & Culture Worldwide's generous sponsorship of past FPGB events and would love to partner with you again this year
. 
 
We offer the following sponsorship opportunities:
 
Tournament Sponsors ($200) and Festival Sponsors ($100)
 receive the following benefits:
Tournament Sponsors
: 
Logo on banners that will be carried by students in the parade and displayed on the sidelines during the tournament
Sponsorship announced by the emcee during the parade
Festival Sponsors
: 
Logo on a large display thanking Festival Sponsors at the entrance to the Fan Festival
Logo in proximity to one game or activity
All Sponsors
: 
B&W logo in the event program and in the school newspaper
Logo included on a large display, promoting the event and thanking sponsors, outside school during the weeks leading up to the event and at the entrance to the event on May 5th
 
Event Sponsors ($300)
 receive all of the benefits of Tournament and Festival Sponsors. In addition, for the remainder of 2023, we will acknowledge your sponsorship by displaying your logo in the FPGB lobby and your logo with website link on our PTA website (
http://fpgpta.org
). 
 
Contributions can be paid online at 
http://fpgpta.org/copa-mundial-sponsor-form
 or via check to “FPGB PTA” with “Copa Mundial Sponsor” in the memo. Please submit your high-resolution logo (2MB) through that online form or by email to our treasurer, Christina Burch, at 
treasurer@fpgpta.org
. In return, we will send your tax deductible receipt, a photo of your logo on display at our Copa Mundial event, and a copy of the event program that features your logo. Thank you for your sponsorship and for making our school and community part of your business.
 
Sincerely,
Sondra Jones
PTA Volunteer
Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe Elementary
 
Mail sponsorship payments to:
Frank Porter Graham PTA 
101 Smith Level Rd.
Chapel Hill, NC 27516
http://fpgpta.org
 
919-942-6491
The FPGB PTA is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organized under the North Carolina PTA, and your sponsorship of our Copa Mundial event is tax deductible. 
The FPGB PTA Tax ID # is 58-1595686.

> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 22, 2023 8:38 PM
To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Interested in sponsoring Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe event?
 
Dear Rebecca, 
 
We’re reaching out to you on behalf of Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe (FPGB) Elementary’s PTA. FPGB is a dual language public school committed to developing bilingual and biliterate students who are prepared to engage, contribute, and lead in the communities that surround them, both near and far. 
 
On May 5, 2023, FPGB will be hosting an exciting event — Copa Mundial (World Cup) — a school-wide soccer tournament that will include an opening ceremony and a fan festival with music, games, and activities. Based on the success of our past events, we expect Copa Mundial to attract 
more than 600 attendees. 
We appreciate Language & Culture Worldwide's generous sponsorship of past FPGB events and would love to partner with you again this year
. 
 
We offer the following sponsorship opportunities:
 
Tournament Sponsors ($200) and Festival Sponsors ($100)
 receive the following benefits:
Tournament Sponsors
: 
Logo on banners that will be carried by students in the parade and displayed on the sidelines during the tournament
Sponsorship announced by the emcee during the parade
Festival Sponsors
: 
Logo on a large display thanking Festival Sponsors at the entrance to the Fan Festival
Logo in proximity to one game or activity
All Sponsors
: 
B&W logo in the event program and in the school newspaper
Logo included on a large display, promoting the event and thanking sponsors, outside school during the weeks leading up to the event and at the entrance to the event on May 5th
 
Event Sponsors ($300)
 receive all of the benefits of Tournament and Festival Sponsors. In addition, for the remainder of 2023, we will acknowledge your sponsorship by displaying your logo in the FPGB lobby and your logo with website link on our PTA website (
http://fpgpta.org
). 
 
Contributions can be paid online at 
http://fpgpta.org/copa-mundial-sponsor-form
 or via check to “FPGB PTA” with “Copa Mundial Sponsor” in the memo. Please submit your high-resolution logo (2MB) through that online form or by email to our treasurer, Christina Burch, at 
treasurer@fpgpta.org
. In return, we will send your tax deductible receipt, a photo of your logo on display at our Copa Mundial event, and a copy of the event program that features your logo. Thank you for your sponsorship and for making our school and community part of your business.
 
Sincerely,
Sondra Jones
PTA Volunteer
Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe Elementary
 
Mail sponsorship payments to:
Frank Porter Graham PTA 
101 Smith Level Rd.
Chapel Hill, NC 27516
http://fpgpta.org
 
919-942-6491
The FPGB PTA is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organized under the North Carolina PTA, and your sponsorship of our Copa Mundial event is tax deductible. 
The FPGB PTA Tax ID # is 58-1595686.

subject: A true timesaver: Scoro’s one-click-wonders
body:
Login ›
 
Hi Pamela,
Let’s have a look at Scoro’s one-click-wonders – handy shortcuts that make using Scoro in your day-to-day routines remarkably easier! 
1. Quick actions for every need
Need to create a task or event? To save time and clicks, use the ‘+’ icon at the top of the menu bar. This way, you don’t need to go to the dedicated module every time!
2. One click to modify calendar events
Need to modify events in a hurry? Here’s a true click-saver for you!
Don't click 'Modify'. Instead, click the start time on the calendar view to get straight into the event modify view. 
3. One click to modify tasks 
Similar to the calendar events, there's an easier way to make changes to your tasks. All you need to do is hover over the tick-icon in front of your task name, wait for a pencil icon to appear and click on it. 
In addition to the task list view, you can easily modify your tasks this way from your dashboard view, under projects, sales documents, and more. 
Here’s to working smarter!
Team Scoro
 
 
 
© 2022 Scoro Software. | 
www.scoro.com
 
Scoro Software Ltd | The Frames, 1 Phipp Street, EC2A 4PS | London, United Kingdom 
If you need assistance or have any questions, please contact our 
Customer Support
. 
You're receiving this email because you have a Scoro account. If you don't want to receive these emails, feel free to 
Unsubscribe from our emails

subject: One size does not fit all - customize your dashboards
body:
Login ›
 
Hi Pamela,
While our dashboard libraries are useful to setting up dashboards for some more common use cases, one size definitely does not fit for all.
That’s why you can easily customize your Scoro dashboard to show the relevant information you need. To do so, simply create widgets or metrics 
based on your own bookmarks
. 
For example, you can start by adding all the tasks due today as a widget to the dashboard, so you can always be on top of your task list. Or you can set a target for yourself of how many hours you want to log each day or week. 
Go ahead, pick a bookmark and 
add it to your dashboard
 to try it out yourself! 
Here’s to working smarter!
Team Scoro

subject: Scoro Update: Meet the Help Station
body:
Good news! Your Scoro site lcw.scoro.com has been updated! We take good support seriously in Scoro, as we’re ever committed to h...
 
 
 
Log in → 
 
Good news! Your Scoro site 
lcw.scoro.com
 has been updated!
We take good support seriously in Scoro, as we’re ever committed to helping you work smoother and smarter. To make sure the necessary help is always at hand, we’ve created a new clever companion for you – say hello to the Help Station! And we’re topping it off with a few general usability improvements. 
See what we’ve been up to!
Help Station
The 
Help button
 now opens up our brand new 
Help Station
, which serves as a one-stop shop for knowledge-packed tours, videos and articles that teach you how to get the most value out of Scoro. The 
contents are dynamic
 and change as you switch between modules, so you're always offered support materials that are relevant to the exact view you’re currently in. This saves you the trouble of having to do your own digging!
 
If you wish to browse any additional materials, simply 
use the search bar
 – our whole 
Help Center
 is at your fingertips via the search! Type in your keywords to find relevant resources from our knowledge base and access them with a single click. 
Read more
 
Financial data in the project list
You can now evaluate directly in the project list view how you’re progressing against your 
profitability targets
 across the portfolio. We’ve 
added the estimated profit number to the profit column
 so you can track the actual progress against the initial estimations and keep an eye on project health. 
We’ve also 
switched the placement of quoted and actual numbers
 to unify the logic across all views. They’re now displayed the same way as in the Quoted vs Actual table – actual numbers on the top row, quoted sums on the bottom row. 
Read more
 
Time entries in the Calendar view
Last month we added the possibility to rearrange time entries directly in the Planner view to create more specific agendas for the day. This month we’ve made sure that all team members see these 
time entries in the planned order
 when hovering over their 
daily to-do list in the Calendar view
. This way, it’s more convenient for everyone to keep track of priorities and tackle the assigned work in the intended order. 
Read more
 
Modification of recurring events
We’ve improved the updating logic behind recurring events when you modify more than one occurrence. Instead of overwriting the whole event, Scoro now 
overwrites only the fields that get modified
. This also applies to the participant list. When you add or remove a person from all or future occurrences, Scoro now updates information about that particular person without refreshing the whole participant list. 
Read more
 
That's not all! 
See our blog post for more details
.
We do our very best to make Scoro better every day, so we really appreciate your feedback. Let us know what you think at 
help@scoro.com
.
Yours truly,
Team Scoro
 
 
 
© 2023 Scoro Software. | 
www.scoro.com
 
Scoro Software Ltd | The Frames, 1 Phipp Street, EC2A 4PS | London, United Kingdom 
If you need assistance or have any questions, please contact our 
Customer Support
.

Alisa:
 
As discussed last week, please see attached for updated copies of the Plan and additional copies of the RSU Award Agreement form and the Board consent to adopt the plan and put this in place. Here are the next steps:
 
Circulate consent and Plan to the Board for approval;
Once approved, load into Carta and have them run a 409A valuation;
After 409A valuation is prepared, adopt the 409A price as the exercise price in a separate consent. 
Upon this final action, you may begin issuing awards to participants in the Plan.

From:

Sent:
 Wednesday, March 22, 2023 8:38 PM
To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Interested in sponsoring Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe event?
 
Dear Rebecca, 
 
We’re reaching out to you on behalf of Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe (FPGB) Elementary’s PTA. FPGB is a dual language public school committed to developing bilingual and biliterate students who are prepared to engage, contribute, and lead in the communities that surround them, both near and far. 
 
On May 5, 2023, FPGB will be hosting an exciting event — Copa Mundial (World Cup) — a school-wide soccer tournament that will include an opening ceremony and a fan festival with music, games, and activities. Based on the success of our past events, we expect Copa Mundial to attract 
more than 600 attendees. 
We appreciate Language & Culture Worldwide's generous sponsorship of past FPGB events and would love to partner with you again this year
. 
 
We offer the following sponsorship opportunities:
 
Tournament Sponsors ($200) and Festival Sponsors ($100)
 receive the following benefits:
Tournament Sponsors
: 
Logo on banners that will be carried by students in the parade and displayed on the sidelines during the tournament
Sponsorship announced by the emcee during the parade
Festival Sponsors
: 
Logo on a large display thanking Festival Sponsors at the entrance to the Fan Festival
Logo in proximity to one game or activity
All Sponsors
: 
B&W logo in the event program and in the school newspaper
Logo included on a large display, promoting the event and thanking sponsors, outside school during the weeks leading up to the event and at the entrance to the event on May 5th
 
Event Sponsors ($300)
 receive all of the benefits of Tournament and Festival Sponsors. In addition, for the remainder of 2023, we will acknowledge your sponsorship by displaying your logo in the FPGB lobby and your logo with website link on our PTA website (
http://fpgpta.org

 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Interested in sponsoring Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe event?
 
Dear Rebecca, 
 
We’re reaching out to you on behalf of Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe (FPGB) Elementary’s PTA. FPGB is a dual language public school committed to developing bilingual and biliterate students who are prepared to engage, contribute, and lead in the communities that surround them, both near and far. 
 
On May 5, 2023, FPGB will be hosting an exciting event — Copa Mundial (World Cup) — a school-wide soccer tournament that will include an opening ceremony and a fan festival with music, games, and activities. Based on the success of our past events, we expect Copa Mundial to attract 
more than 600 attendees. 
We appreciate Language & Culture Worldwide's generous sponsorship of past FPGB events and would love to partner with you again this year
. 
 
We offer the following sponsorship opportunities:
 
Tournament Sponsors ($200) and Festival Sponsors ($100)
 receive the following benefits:
Tournament Sponsors
: 
Logo on banners that will be carried by students in the parade and displayed on the sidelines during the tournament
Sponsorship announced by the emcee during the parade
Festival Sponsors
: 
Logo on a large display thanking Festival Sponsors at the entrance to the Fan Festival
Logo in proximity to one game or activity
All Sponsors
: 
B&W logo in the event program and in the school newspaper
Logo included on a large display, promoting the event and thanking sponsors, outside school during the weeks leading up to the event and at the entrance to the event on May 5th
 
Event Sponsors ($300)
 receive all of the benefits of Tournament and Festival Sponsors. In addition, for the remainder of 2023, we will acknowledge your sponsorship by displaying your logo in the FPGB lobby and your logo with website link on our PTA website (
http://fpgpta.org
). 
 
Contributions can be paid online at 
http://fpgpta.org/copa-mundial-sponsor-form
 or via check to “FPGB PTA” with “Copa Mundial Sponsor” in the memo. Please submit your high-resolution logo (2MB) through that online form or by email to our treasurer, Christina Burch, at 
treasurer@fpgpta.org
. In return, we will send your tax deductible receipt, a photo of your logo on display at our Copa Mundial event, and a copy of the event program that features your logo. Thank you for your sponsorship and for making our school and community part of your business.
 
Sincerely,
Sondra Jones
PTA Volunteer
Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe Elementary
 
Mail sponsorship payments to:
Frank Porter Graham PTA 
101 Smith Level Rd.
Chapel Hill, NC 27516
http://fpgpta.org
 
919-942-6491
The FPGB PTA is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organized under the North Carolina PTA, and your sponsorship of our Copa Mundial event is tax deductible. 
The FPGB PTA Tax ID # is 58-1595686.

FW: Overdue payment
Hey Pam,
I’m not sure what happened (as in, how did bill.com let her get set up in the system [or let us set her up] , if it can’t make a payment to her bank?)
 
Regardless, Uta is a long-time translator – so it would be best if we prioritized getting this resolved for her. Especially since the payment is now late unfortunately.
 
Let me know if I can help in any way.
Thanks,
Randy
 
 
From:
 Dr. Uta Lausberg - Global Business Linguistics <
info@globiztics.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 29, 2023 17:37
To:
 Randall Stieghorst <
r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Overdue payment
 
Dear Randall,
 
I hope this message finds you well. I would like to ask you a big favor. I invoiced several tasks to Maria Fagrelius/Maya Benoit in February but I have not received payment, which was due on March 25. Maria wanted to follow up with Accounting but it seems that she is not at the office, and Maya has not responded.
 
Something very strange happened with this payment. On March 21, I received an email notification from a service called Bill.com that my payment was under way and would be in my bank account on March 24 (attached). However, I have not received any payment and my bank has no record of this payment. Bill.com does not provide any information. All I found out is that they seem to mail checks within the U.S. and that they send payments to other Bill.com accounts but that for opening such an account, you need to have your residency within the U.S. So basically, this is only a local service and not viable for me. My bank in Guatemala does not work with any brokers of that kind.
 
I have no idea why this local service was involved with my international payment but for sure, it did not work. The payment is now overdue.
 
Could you please look into this and issue a new payment via wire transfer to the bank account indicated in my invoice (attached)? Please do not use Bill.com for paying my invoices and flag this issue to your AP staff.
 
Kind regards,
Uta
 
 
Dr. Uta Lausberg
Global Business Linguistics
4a. Calle Lote 108 Fr. 4
Residenciales Los Alpes, zona 1
03008 San Lucas Sacatepéquez
GUATEMALA
 
P +502 4063-9431
E 
info@globiztics.com
Skype: utalausberg

Director of Content & Research, LCW
 
From:
 Sondra Jones <
sondra.sj.jones@gmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 22, 2023 8:38 PM
To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Interested in sponsoring Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe event?
 
Dear Rebecca, 
 
We’re reaching out to you on behalf of Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe (FPGB) Elementary’s PTA. FPGB is a dual language public school committed to developing bilingual and biliterate students who are prepared to engage, contribute, and lead in the communities that surround them, both near and far. 
 
On May 5, 2023, FPGB will be hosting an exciting event — Copa Mundial (World Cup) — a school-wide soccer tournament that will include an opening ceremony and a fan festival with music, games, and activities. Based on the success of our past events, we expect Copa Mundial to attract 
more than 600 attendees. 
We appreciate Language & Culture Worldwide's generous sponsorship of past FPGB events and would love to partner with you again this year
. 
 
We offer the following sponsorship opportunities:
 
Tournament Sponsors ($200) and Festival Sponsors ($100)
 receive the following benefits:
Tournament Sponsors
: 
Logo on banners that will be carried by students in the parade and displayed on the sidelines during the tournament
Sponsorship announced by the emcee during the parade
Festival Sponsors
: 
Logo on a large display thanking Festival Sponsors at the entrance to the Fan Festival
Logo in proximity to one game or activity
All Sponsors
: 
B&W logo in the event program and in the school newspaper
Logo included on a large display, promoting the event and thanking sponsors, outside school during the weeks leading up to the event and at the entrance to the event on May 5th
 
Event Sponsors ($300)
 receive all of the benefits of Tournament and Festival Sponsors. In addition, for the remainder of 2023, we will acknowledge your sponsorship by displaying your logo in the FPGB lobby and your logo with website link on our PTA website (
http://fpgpta.org
). 
 
Contributions can be paid online at 
http://fpgpta.org/copa-mundial-sponsor-form
 or via check to “FPGB PTA” with “Copa Mundial Sponsor” in the memo. Please submit your high-resolution logo (2MB) through that online form or by email to our treasurer, Christina Burch, at 
treasurer@fpgpta.org
. In return, we will send your tax deductible receipt, a photo of your logo on display at our Copa Mundial event, and a copy of the event program that features your logo. Thank you for your sponsorship and for making our school and community part of your business.
 
Sincerely,
Sondra Jones
PTA Volunteer
Frank Porter Graham Bilingüe Elementary
 
Mail sponsorship payments to:
Frank Porter Graham PTA 
101 Smith Level Rd.
Chapel Hill, NC 27516
http://fpgpta.org
 
919-942-6491
The FPGB PTA is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organized under the North Carolina PTA, and your sponsorship of our Copa Mundial event is tax deductible. 
The FPGB PTA Tax ID # is 58-1595686.

subject: FW: Overdue payment
body:
Hey Pam,
I’m not sure what happened (as in, how did bill.com let her get set up in the system [or let us set her up] , if it can’t make a payment to her bank?)
 
Regardless, Uta is a long-time translator – so it would be best if we prioritized getting this resolved for her. Especially since the payment is now late unfortunately.
 
Let me know if I can help in any way.
Thanks,
Randy
 
 
From:
 Dr. Uta Lausberg - Global Business Linguistics <info@globiztics.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 29, 2023 17:37
To:
 Randall Stieghorst <r.stieghorst@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Overdue payment
 
Dear Randall,
 
I hope this message finds you well. I would like to ask you a big favor. I invoiced several tasks to Maria Fagrelius/Maya Benoit in February but I have not received payment, which was due on March 25. Maria wanted to follow up with Accounting but it seems that she is not at the office, and Maya has not responded.
 
Something very strange happened with this payment. On March 21, I received an email notification from a service called Bill.com that my payment was under way and would be in my bank account on March 24 (attached). However, I have not received any payment and my bank has no record of this payment. Bill.com does not provide any information. All I found out is that they seem to mail checks within the U.S. and that they send payments to other Bill.com accounts but that for opening such an account, you need to have your residency within the U.S. So basically, this is only a local service and not viable for me. My bank in Guatemala does not work with any brokers of that kind.
 
I have no idea why this local service was involved with my international payment but for sure, it did not work. The payment is now overdue.
 
Could you please look into this and issue a new payment via wire transfer to the bank account indicated in my invoice (attached)? Please do not use Bill.com for paying my invoices and flag this issue to your AP staff.
 
Kind regards,
Uta
 
 
Dr. Uta Lausberg
Global Business Linguistics
4a. Calle Lote 108 Fr. 4
Residenciales Los Alpes, zona 1
03008 San Lucas Sacatepéquez
GUATEMALA
 
P +502 4063-9431
E 
info@globiztics.com
Skype: utalausberg

body:
Hi Pamela, 
Your Mar. 2, 2023–Mar. 17, 2023 payroll has been submitted: 
Direct deposits (29 employees): $77,289.43

Mar. 29, 2023

Thanks, 
Zenefits

subject: A message from BILL CEO and Founder
body:
An update on our response to the Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) events.
  
 
 
 
Dear valued customers,
I wanted to update you on our response to the Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) events. Our top priority is to support our customers. In the days since events unfolded, we have been processing pending transactions, and I'm happy to report that all SVB-related outstanding payments have been processed, and we're fully back to business as usual for payment processing.
On Monday, we announced 
new programs
 to help customers stay operational, including BILL balance, Divvy, BILL Pay by Card, invoice financing for your vendors on the BILL network, and extended payment terms for Divvy account holders impacted by SVB.
We have scaled up our support capabilities to meet increased demand and are here to help. If your business needs support, please don't hesitate to 
contact us
.
Thank you to those who have provided open communication and feedback during this stressful time. We value your trust and transparent partnerships. The BILL team will continue to work hard every day to honor that trust.
René

I was wondering if you noticed this email from Maya – we have not received an answer. Our Cantonese translator encountered the same issue, he’s located in HK. We’re trying to expedite their invoices into the system so they can get paid on time. Right now, Maya is holding onto these invoices. 
Could you please let us know next steps? Thanks!
 
 
María

 Maya Benoit <M.Benoit@lcwmail.com>

 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>; Pamela Coulter <p.coulter@lcwmail.com>

Subject:
 RE: Update account details - Veronica Mattalia
Importance:
 High
 
Hi Pamela,
 
Can you please provide more info?
 
I asked Veronica to check if she received the invitation, however she informed me of the following:
I have not received the invitation yet, but I tried to login into the platform and it asks for an EE.UU address and I'm not a local resident, so I cannot move ahead to update the banking information.
 
 
I believe yesterday I forwarded an email from another linguist Anthony Nga with the same issue.
A lot of our translators will be located in other countries, so that would be an issue if bill.com doesn’t support that.
 
If it is easier, you can reach out directly Veronica (her original email is below), but please keep me in cc so I stay updated on this issue.
I still need to submit her invoice, so I don’t want to delay that too much.
 
Thanks,
Maya

subject: Scoro Update: Improved Planner and Work Management
body:
Good news! Your Scoro site lcw.scoro.com has been updated! Good planning tools help you make smart decisions and set your projec...
 
 
 
Log in → 
 
Good news! Your Scoro site 
lcw.scoro.com
 has been updated!
Good planning tools help you make smart decisions and set your project up for success right from the get-go. So this month we’re all about making Scoro’s Planner even more powerful! On top of that, we’ve further improved some filtering, exporting and calendar sync options in Scoro. 
See what we’ve been up to!
Planner improvements
We’ve further improved the 
Planner's
 scheduling capabilities. You can now 
adjust the order of scheduled events and time entries
 directly in the Planner view 
with a simple drag and drop
. This means project managers can easily distribute tasks across the team and control agendas for the day in a single view. This helps to ensure that all team members tackle tasks in the best possible order, which streamlines processes and prevents bottlenecks. 
Read more
 
Filtering of time entries
You can now 
filter out only the done or scheduled time entries
 in the task detailed view to do away with any noise and quickly access the information you need. For example, if you just want to focus on what’s still left to do, simply filter out only the scheduled time entries. This is especially useful in time-entry-heavy tasks. Scoro will always remember your latest preference across all tasks. 
Read more
 
Global settings for calendar integrations
Admin users can now manage 
Google Calendar
 and 
MS Exchange Calendar
 settings for all site users collectively to improve data quality and minimize sync errors. We’ve added a 
Global settings
 tab to both integrations, letting admins enable/disable the sync for all users simultaneously and control settings like sync direction, event name format and status mapping to ensure consistency across the site. In addition, it’s possible to manage domain aliases with global settings to help Scoro match alternate emails with the right users. 
Read more
 
That's not all! 
See our blog post for more details
.
We do our very best to make Scoro better every day, so we really appreciate your feedback. Let us know what you think at 
help@scoro.com
.
Yours truly,
Team Scoro
 
 
 
© 2023 Scoro Software. | 
www.scoro.com
 
Scoro Software Ltd | The Frames, 1 Phipp Street, EC2A 4PS | London, United Kingdom 
If you need assistance or have any questions, please contact our 
Customer Support
.

subject: Activity types: Find out what you spend your time on
body:
Login ›
 
Hi Pamela,
Ever wondering where your time is going? Scoro’s 
activity types
 are there to help you find out. This way, you’ll be able to avoid time-wasting activities, and increase your efficiency instead. 
An 
activity type
 is a common predefined action (e.g. e-mail, meeting notes, project preparation etc.) which enables to filter the work report and gives a great overview of what type of activities you are spending most of your time on. 
Out of all the activity types created for the site, select the activity types
 you are using the most
 for easy access. These will be displayed first in the list when adding events and tasks.
Now, 
go and set up yours
!
Here’s to working smarter!
Team Scoro
 
 
 
© 2022 Scoro Software. | 
www.scoro.com
 
Scoro Software Ltd | The Frames, 1 Phipp Street, EC2A 4PS | London, United Kingdom 
If you need assistance or have any questions, please contact our 
Customer Support
. 
You're receiving this email because you have a Scoro account. If you don't want to receive these emails, feel free to 
Unsubscribe from our emails
.

subject: Bill.com clearing - 2 double entries
body:
Hey Pam,
There is a double entry in January for a bill.com payment. I’m not sure how they appear on the statement, but historically it all came out of bill.com clearing – and then paid the vendor through them. But lately the entries are showing the name of the vendor who was paid with bill.com. Perhaps the EFTs come out now one by one from the bank…but just a heads up on this double entry.
 
There is another similar entry in February, for $1000.
 
In total, those are the 2 discrepancies that keep the bank feed from matching QB.
 
Thx,
R
 
 
Randall Stieghorst
 
Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC
4753 N Broadway St, 2
nd
 Floor

From:
 Randall Stieghorst

 Saturday, March 4, 2023 8:42
To:
 Michelle Murcia <m.murcia@lcwmail.com>; Pamela Coulter <p.coulter@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 QB balances for Citi Deposits
 
I was correcting some deposits made over the past few months (credited to the wrong invoices, etc.) and now it appears that the QB balance is *
higher
* than the Bank Balance for Citi. Unfortunately, I don’t recall if that same imbalance existed when I began correcting invoices. Either way, we’ll need to get the bank statements and reconcile Jan and Feb. (and then, see where there may be a duplicate transaction).
 
David, the previous accountant, did a rather poor job of matching payments to invoices – I found one from AIG that was matched to a Voya invoice, for example.
 
Thx,
R

Sin perjuicio de ello se le informa de que usted podrá ejercitar los derechos de acceso, rectificación, supresión, portabilidad, limitación u oposición al tratamiento de sus datos  para lo cual debe dirigirse a Intercultural Understanding, SL en la siguiente dirección c/ Virgen del Portillo, 7 - 28027 MADRID adjuntando fotocopia del documento acreditativo de identidad o bien por correo electrónico a 
info@interculturalunderstanding.eu
 
 En virtud de la ley 34/2002 de 11 de Julio de Servicios de la Sociedad de la Información y Correo Electrónico (LSSI-CE), este mensaje y sus archivos adjuntos pueden contener información confidencial, por lo que se informa de que su uso no autorizado está prohibido por la ley. Si ha recibido este mensaje por equivocación, por favor notifíquelo inmediatamente a través de esta misma vía y borre el mensaje original junto con sus ficheros adjuntos sin leerlo o grabarlo total o parcialmente.

From:
 Zenefits <noreply@zenefits.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, February 28, 2023 1:48 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Nicole Barile Will be Terminated from Language & Culture Worldwide on March 3rd, 2023
 
We've received your request to terminate Nicole Barile on 03/03/2023. Don't worry, we won't send them any communication. 
Here's what Zenefits will take care of:
Payroll: We'll mark Nicole for termination in payroll on 
03/03/2023
, and continue to pay them unless you manually remove them. Issue their last pay check by running termination payroll. 
Not sure how? 
We recommend you understand 
your state's specific final paycheck requirements 
to remain compliant with the law. 
COBRA: COBRA Complete is administering COBRA for Nicole Barile. Zenefits will send Nicole's information to COBRA Complete within 24 hours after the termination date. If you have any questions, please email 
COBRAComplete@healthaccountservices.com
. 
Here's what you need to take care of:
 
Final Payment: As applicable, you'll want to give a final payment via check or direct deposit, and any final severance payments thereafter. This amount may vary depending on your termination agreement. You'll want to confirm and pass any payment with your payroll provider, to ensure that the correct payroll taxes are logged. 
Termination & Severance Paperwork: If your company uses any termination forms, you'll want to get the individual to sign them and you'll want to 
add the signed documents here
 for future reference. 
If you have any questions or concerns feel free to 
contact us.
 
Thanks,
Zenefits
For more information or assistance, please visit 
help.zenefits.com
.

Subject: 
Expense report stuff
Hi again,
 
Before I send the handbook out to all EEs, can you please make sure this is all correct, per our convo?
 
Expense Reporting Requirements
 
(for both client-reimbursed and internal LCW travel)
: 
An expense report must be submitted within one (1) week following the trip. 
Itemized receipts are required for all travel expenses.
A credit card statement line item is not sufficient as a receipt.
If for any reason the date on the receipt does not match the date of travel – highlight this in the email you submit along with an explanation as to how this happened. 
For all meals, you must also clearly note on the receipt who was present (e.g., client, company) and the purpose of the meal; if not, in most cases the meal will be considered a personal expense and deducted from your paycheck, bonus, or future reimbursements. 
Always be proactive if there are any irregularities or discrepancies and communicate these to accounting@ right away via email. 
LCW credit cards should be used for client-related charges only. If using an LCW credit card, please use the Expense Report template and submit to accounting by the 10
th
 of the month (for the prior month’s charges).
If using a personal credit card, please use the Expense Report template and submit to accounting on the 1
st
 and 15
th
 of every month. You will be reimbursed at the next pay cycle (roughly 15 days after submission).
 
Thank you so much!
 
Nicole Barile
Director of Operations
, 
LCW
Email: 
n.barile@lcwmail.com
Phone: +1 773 888 9294 [EST]

Subject: 
Expense report stuff
Hi again,
 
Before I send the handbook out to all EEs, can you please make sure this is all correct, per our convo?
 
Expense Reporting Requirements
 
(for both client-reimbursed and internal LCW travel)
: 
An expense report must be submitted within one (1) week following the trip. 
Itemized receipts are required for all travel expenses.
A credit card statement line item is not sufficient as a receipt.
If for any reason the date on the receipt does not match the date of travel – highlight this in the email you submit along with an explanation as to how this happened. 
For all meals, you must also clearly note on the receipt who was present (e.g., client, company) and the purpose of the meal; if not, in most cases the meal will be considered a personal expense and deducted from your paycheck, bonus, or future reimbursements. 
Always be proactive if there are any irregularities or discrepancies and communicate these to accounting@ right away via email. 
LCW credit cards should be used for client-related charges only. If using an LCW credit card, please use the Expense Report template and submit to accounting by the 10
th
 of the month (for the prior month’s charges).
If using a personal credit card, please use the Expense Report template and submit to accounting on the 1
st
 and 15
th
 of every month. You will be reimbursed at the next pay cycle (roughly 15 days after submission).
 
Thank you so much!
 
Nicole Barile
Director of Operations
, 
LCW
Email: 
n.barile@lcwmail.com
Phone: +1 773 888 9294 [EST]

subject: Maria Mercado Zenefits Onboarding Complete
body:
Hi Pamela, 
Maria Mercado just finished onboarding in Zenefits! All their personal, bank and tax information will be synced to Zenefits Payroll within 1 business day, once their information has been checked for any missing entries. We're cc'ing your accountant so they have this information, in case they handle everything payroll. 
In the documents section of their 
profile
, you'll find their hire documents (e.g., offer letter, agreements) and tax documents (e.g., W-4, or W-9), as applicable.
Here's what you'll need to do to make sure Maria is all set:
 
Within 3 days of their first day, you should 
complete the employer's section of Form I-9 in Zenefits
. To comply with USCIS regulations, you'll need to view physical copies of the individual's work-verification documents; here's a 
list of acceptable documents
.
If Maria hadn't finished onboarding in time for their first payroll date, you may need to run an off-cycle payroll.
If you have any questions, feel free to 
contact us.
 
Thanks,
Zenefits
For more information or assistance, please visit 
help.zenefits.com
.

st
 of the month (meaning if her coverage were cancelled on the 13
th

st
 of the month, we can typically report that back to the insurer and receive an invoice credit (and we can credit her back for any premiums withheld).  
 
Alisa, what have you typically done in the past?

María

>

m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com
>

Could you still let me know about the credit of the previous incorrect payment?

Audit person is asking for the evidence of the payment
 and the 
credit info for the last invoice's adjustment

Thanks,
Maya

subject: RE: Form 1099-NEC
body:
Thank you. Let me tell the translator we will issue a new one.
 
 
 
María
 
From:
 Jennifer Barbieri <j.barbieri@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, February 16, 2023 1:23 AM
To:
 Maria Fagrelius <m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com>; Pamela Coulter <p.coulter@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Accounting <accounting@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Form 1099-NEC
 
Hi Maria – I can tell you what happened here. We have 2 Quickbooks accounts. One for pre acquisition and one for post (April 1 2022 to present). Randy ran the 1099s for Q1 and I compiled it with Q2-Q4. Since the amounts from below (Q1) are less than the threshold for filing the 1099s, it was not included in the combined total filing. That being said, we can reissue with the new amount.
 
@Pamela Coulter
 would you be able to do this? We filed the 1099s through QBO.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer
 
From:
 Maria Fagrelius <
m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, February 15, 2023 5:17 PM
To:
 Pamela Coulter <
p.coulter@lcwmail.com
>; Jennifer Barbieri <
j.barbieri@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 FW: Form 1099-NEC
 
Hi! Can you please check per email chain below? I received an email today from the translator:
“
I don't think it is resolved. I did receive a paper Form 1099-NEC and it says $1399.90 like the online form. I think the amount should be $1591.82.”
Kindly let me know if you could please check our records. Thank you!
 
 
María
 
From:
 Maria Fagrelius 
Sent:
 Monday, January 30, 2023 7:57 AM
To:
 Accounting <
accounting@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 FW: Form 1099-NEC
 
Hello!
Can you look into this please? See below from Miyo, a translator.
Thank you very much!!!
 
 
María
 
From:
 miyo tat <
miyot@comcast.net
> 
Sent:
 Monday, January 30, 2023 12:29 AM
To:
 Maria Fagrelius <
m.fagrelius@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Form 1099-NEC
 
Hi Maria, 
 
I received Form 1099-NEC. 
It looks like not all of the payment is included in the total amount. 
I looked at "Payment History" in QuickBooks against my record and it looks like the following two payments are not included: 
 
Amount $97.64; Job 21180: American Honda; Invoice # 3286; Date Invoiced 12/30/2021; Payment Received 1/10/2022 
Amount $94.28; Job 22009: NuVasive CoC module; Invoice # 3307; Date Invoiced: 3/6/2022; Payment received 3/10/2022 
 
Could you check your record and let me know? 
Thank you very much. 
Sincerely,
Miyo M. Tat
ATA-Certified English-to-Japanese Translator
miyot@comcast.net
425-228-4596

subject: RE: Form 1099-NEC
body:
Hi Maria – I can tell you what happened here. We have 2 Quickbooks accounts. One for pre acquisition and one for post (April 1 2022 to present). Randy ran the 1099s for Q1 and I compiled it with Q2-Q4. Since the amounts from below (Q1) are less than the threshold for filing the 1099s, it was not included in the combined total filing. That being said, we can reissue with the new amount.
 
@Pamela Coulter
 would you be able to do this? We filed the 1099s through QBO.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer

Hello team,
Attached is a new module for Compliance Wave, for their client Quanta.
We have translated for them this year, project 22055. Same instructions for translation:
 
Per client:
 We’re going to translate everything but “Quanta”, “Quanta’s”, and “Legal Compliance & Ethics”.  
 
Quanta = 
do not translate 
Quanta’s = 
do not translate 
Legal Compliance & Ethics = 
do not translate 
(you can change the ampersand to “y” in Spanish, etc.) 
Anti-Corruption Compliance Policy = 
translate 
to Spanish and French as a name 
Political Activity Policy = 
translate 
to Spanish and French as a name  
 
Teams and languages:
FrCA: Marie-Stephanie translation and Anne-Marie proof
SpLA: Mario, please include proofing
 
Due date (including proofing):
 Tuesday, October 25
th
.

 - 
https://360.articulate.com/review/content/647255d3-eabc-49b5-a0ff-03ab8f6a6d1e/review

subject: You've successfully reset your LCW Dropbox account password
body:
Hi Pamela,
Your LCW Dropbox account password was recently reset.
While we've updated your password, any computers or phones that you previously linked to your Dropbox account are still connected. You can disconnect a lost or stolen device in your 
account settings
.
If you changed your password for security reasons, we strongly recommend you unlink any devices, web sessions, or apps that look unfamiliar or that you’re concerned about. See 
this Help Center article
 for more information.
If you didn’t make this change, please 
let us know
.
Thanks,
The Dropbox Team
© 2023 Dropbox

subject: Reset your Dropbox password
body:
Hi Pamela,
Someone recently requested a password change for your Dropbox account. If this was you, you can set a new password here: 
Reset password
If you don't want to change your password or didn't request this, just ignore and delete this message.
To keep your account secure, please don't forward this email to anyone. See our Help Center for 
more security tips
.
Happy Dropboxing!

subject: RE: accounting@
body:
It doesn’t have a password – it is shared…and can only be accessed by people who are logged into their own email account (and it is then shared with them). 
 
Tech Support should be able to guide you how to make it appear in your list of email accounts in your Outlook – that’s a bit beyond my scope, unfortunately!
Cheers,
Randy
